story:
What is Musicians Across Borders? 

Musicians Across Borders is the non-profit outreach initiative of the summer music camp, Hamptons Music Sessions (HMS).

  • Musicians Across Borders students come from under-served environments and areas of conflict, where the educational infrastructure is fragile or non-existent due to political unrest or budget restrictions.

  • Musicians Across Borders sponsors children who are particularly passionate about their musical studies.  They are nominated to HMS through various outreach organizations, schools, and by individual teachers.  HMS then screens them via written application and personal interview (live or over the phone/skype).  The program has been such demand that there is a waiting list of 2 years already! 

 

What makes Hamptons Music Sessions special?

  • At HMS, students have the opportunity to study intensely with internationally acclaimed teachers and performers.  Check out our exciting core curriculum, designed by a team of educational experts:  http://hamptonsmusic.org/schedule
  • What makes HMS truly UNIQUE is the outreach component!  It's part of the fabric and identity of HMS.  Students from all over the world convene at HMS to study music at a high level, of course, but also to share and appreciate each other's cultures. 

 

What will the funds be used for?

This campaign is to raise scholarship & travel funds for the students of Musicians Across Borders who have been nominated to attend HMS this August.

We know that there are a myriad of campaigns you can give to, and we sincerely sincerely sincerely appreciate your support.  Therefore, we like to be as transparent and specific for our patrons.  Here's the breakdown:

  • $12.5K is needed to fund 5 outreach scholarships: tuition for each scholar is $2500.  4 scholars are from NYC inner-city schools and 1 is from Tunisia.  We are also hosting 2 scholars from Afghanistan, their scholarships funds were raised during our spring benefit concert held this past April.

  • $10K is needed to fund the transportation costs of all 7 of our outreach scholars, 3 of whom are traveling from very, very far away and are dealing with very complicated visa issues.  We have secured permission from the governement and various embassies to host these kids at HMS, but it is a very expensive and complex undertaking!

 

The Impact and Magnitude of your contribution

Your contribution makes a TRUE difference in the lives of the children we serve!

  • Just imagine: how amazing is it that YOU can make it possible for a student from an underprivileged situation to make his/her first voyage ever to the USA? Talk about making dreams come true...these kids are so incredibly passionate about music.  Attending a program like HMS where their talents can be nurtured by top-notch instructors is truly a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for them.

  • The outreach scholars are not the only students who benefit from this campaign!  The entire HMS student body learns about celebrating cultural diversity.  Through this type of international exchange, everyone learns to appreciate different cultures and the kids learn first-hand about the unifying, communicative power of Music.

  • Double your dollar, double your impact!  This campaign has an incredibly exciting motor driving it:  an angel patron has pledged to match the ENTIRE campaign if it is successful.  Think of the impact THAT will have on our deserving outreach scholars!

 

Our proven track record

  • Last year, we made it possible for one boy to leave his country for the first time ever.  He got on a plane for the first time ever.  He got to see the USA for the first time ever-  tried his first hot dog ever, walked the streets of NYC for the first time ever, and experienced the American lifestyle he had only been able to see in the movies.   After studying at HMS, he learned that it was possible to pursue Music as a career and is now a full-time music student back at home.  THIS is the kind of impact your contribution will have!

  • Visit www.hamptonsmusic.org to see all of the beautiful testimonials left by our outreach students who have previously attended HMS.  In their own words, you can see the positive and lasting impression that the HMS experience has left on them.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign:  you can help us by forwarding it to as MANY people as you can!  Every bit counts towards making it possible for an outreach student to attend HMS this August.

 

谢谢!  Gracias!  Merci! ありがとう! Danke! תודה Grazie!  спасибо! 감사합니다!  Obrigado!  شكرا 

...thank you.

story:
Our Story

Fashion has long served as a mode of expressing identity and individuality, and for millions of women accross the globe it is also a means of equality and independence.  Social Fabric is a Fair Trade women's clothing company that bridges ancient cultural traditions with contemporary fashion trends to create unique and beautiful designs. 

 

Social Fabric is run by a small team of dedicated creative professionals with backgrounds in Fashion Design,  Arts and International Relations.  Our past projects have taken us all over the world, working with grass roots women's organizations in Africa, studying traditional First Nations clothing production in Arctic Canada, and designing batik in Malaysia. 

 

Last year we visited the Madihu Women's Organization in Sierra Leone where we found some great examples of western Africa's trademark mudcloth prints.  This summer we will be travelling to villages in Central America, India and Southeast Asia to connect with local artisans to acquire spectacular hidden textile gems. Through a collaboration with area tailors we will then design a complete collection to launch the label next spring.

The Impact

Countless women around the world rely on traditional textile production as a means of self-reliance and to provide for their families. For women, earning an income has been demonstrated to help alleviate a variety of risks in developing communities, including susceptibility to trafficking, violence, and sexually transmitted disease.  Many of these textile producers are searching for a means of breaking through to international markets in order to create broader business opportunities.  This project will help provide that market.  


In addition to upholding Fair Trade's key principles of economic and environmental sustainability, Social Fabric will also promote cultural sustainability.  Many traditional textile production practices are being lost to war, extreme poverty, and other factors.  This project will enable these women to maintain important cultural elements of their work and gain competitive advantage in the global market.

 

Social Fabric will also diversify the Canadian Fair Trade market with new socially responsible fashion forward trends.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are currently seeking funding to produce our inaugural collection to be launched in Spring 2012. The amount requested includes the purchase of handmade textiles, supplies, production labour, travel expenses and business start-up costs.

 

The majority of the funds will be directly invested into products and labour in developing communities, including the production of pattern designs. The travel expenses will cover airfare, accommodations and local transport for two people at approximately $4,750 per person.  This travel is necessary to establish contacts and partnerships to ensure the ease of future trade flow.  The remaining funds will be invested in business expenses including website development, marketing and overhead costs at an expected $2,500. 

 

The creation of the initial designs is the first phase of our business plan, which will be completed by September 2011.  We will then present our collection to potential investors in Fall 2011 to proceed to the next stage and expand our financial base in order to make the collection available.

 

Investors will benefit from fabulous perks including handmade goods, discounts on merchandise and invitations to the runway launch event.


Other Ways You Can Help

1. Tell your friends about us and show us some facebook and twitter love. 

2. Click the Feature It button at the bottom right of this page so everyone can see us.

3. Microwave some popcorn and show our video to your friends.

4. Help encourage the Fair Trade market.

story:
About Me

My name is Caitlin Bergman. I am originally from the Bay Area and have worked in Education in the Bay Area for the past ten years. I received my Masters in Education from Mills College in 2012. I have been teaching for over four years in Oakland and Richmond.

This year, I will be teaching first grade in the Fruitvale District of Oakland. All of my students are students of color, who are learning how to read, write and learning about themselves. Many of these children are living in poverty and experience marginalization and violence daily, but, they also experience love, joy, family celebrations; and they all have hopes and dreams. 

The Project

I want my students to be able to share and celebrate their culture, family and community, through photographs. I want them to be able to explore and share the positive aspects of their lives, school, and community. My goal is to support my students in feeling proud of where they come from, and that their lives and experiences are worth documenting, sharing and celebrating. I believe in the arts, and in students exploring themselves as artists, in this case photographers. These photographs will then be the inspiration for authentic writing and cultural exploration.

While I was teaching in Richmond, we used photography to explore various aspects of students' lives and families, as well as the local community. Students were filled with a sense of pride and purpose about their lives and the photographs allowed for authentic writing and sharing opportunities.

Why?

By donating to this project, and funding the purchase of digital cameras for my first grade class in Oakland, you are showing these children that they are important, their lives matter and are worth sharing, and that there are beautiful, positive aspects of their lives and community that should be documented and written about. We are having a community EXPO and the first grade classes will present pieces of art and writing about their families and community. I would love to use photographs and writing about the photographs in the exhibition.

All too often, these children are not given quality learning materials. I want to show my students that their lives and experiences should be celebrated and shared, and that they are worthy of using quality school supplies, and that their story and community can be captured through photographs.

Your donation will show these students that people care about them and want their experiences to be shared. It will show them that their stories are worth telling, that they need to tell them to the world, and that they are important. Please pass this project on to anyone else who may be interested. 

Thank you!!!!

story:
The International Women's Academy builds sustainable systems and infrastructure to enable the empowerment of women to become future leaders. The core of our organization are the IWA Clubs which link girls and women, in well resourced and privileged schools and universities, with those who are in need.

In the Guizhou Project students from Shanghai have been working with a number of girls in a remote village in Guizhou Province, China.

          http://www.iwa-education.com/guizhou-project.html

  

They plan to provide these girls with new computers and an internet connection. However, more importantly, by utilising the IWA Club network, they will link them to...

1. Mentors who will be able to support their education with a focus on Maths, English and Chinese (The core subjects of their local examination system which will enable them to enter university).

2. Students in the USA who wish to study Chinese conversation, and so providing them with a sustainable income for their education.

The funds raised through this campaign will be used to purchase at least 2 computers, software, internet connections for at least 2 years, and a camera to allow the girls to record their life and illustrate the benefits they are obtaining from the technology.

If we exceed our goal of 3000 US$, this will enable us to purchase computers for additional girls in this village and other locations globally.

The girls we plan to support come from a family with very limited resources. The girls share the responsibility of supporting the family in the future and a good education is the best route to enable this. We have selected this family as the girls are very motivated and have a real drive to improve their situation.

  

Our club members from Shanghai have already given them IT training, and provided them with an old computer to allow them to start to build up their IT skills to enable them to get the most from the further support we plan to give.

Please support our campaign or get involved by starting an IWA Club in your school, university or company....

          http://www.iwa-education.com/100-club-challenge.html

With your support we can empower these girls to change their own lives through the advantage of a sustainable education.

   

Youku introduction video available here for all our Chinese friends.

http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XNTk5Njg1MTM2.html

Thank you from all at IWA!

story:
The Opportunity:

Ever since I was a kid, the two places I have wanted to visit the most have been Sydney, Australia and the safaris of Africa. This summer, I have been offered the exciting opportunity to cross one of those off of my list.

My name is Sydney Levan. I am a junior in the pre-medical program at Virginia Commonwealth University, but my academic career started at John Tyler Community College. During my studies at JTCC, I was invited to join the honors society for two-year colleges across the nation called Phi Theta Kappa, which required a 3.5 GPA to enter. Phi Theta Kappa proved to be a great resource for me as it helped my entry into VCU and offered many opportunities for advancing my education. The most recent invitation I received from Phi Theta Kappa was the most exciting one yet: an invitation to represent the United States in the International Scholar Laureate Program: Delegation on Medicine and Science. The program is very exclusive (invitation only) and a once in a lifetime opportunity to study medical topics in New Zealand and Australia.

The purpose of this campaign is to help offset the costs of the program by providing funds for the plane ticket to travel from the United States to the program in New Zealand and Australia and back. The tuition for the program covers the cost of travel while in the program as well as meals and activities, but not the flights there and back. 

The Goal:

My goal for this fundraiser is to raise the $1,800 needed for airfare while having a great time for my 21st birthday and St. Patrick's Day with my friends, family, and supporters. 

I have set the goal at $500 as that was the minimum required by the site. The site will take a higher percentage of the funds raised if you do not meet your goal, so I thought $500 was a safe number that I could reach.

If my goal is reached, any remaining funds will go directly to the cost of tuition, which I am paying for using the last of my student loan money. If my goal is not reached, the remaining needed will come out of my personal savings account.

The Event:

I thought that a great way to get everybody together for a social event/fundraiser was to host a dodge ball tournament!

The event will be held at XL Sports World (formerly RISE) on their indoor turf fields on March 15, 2014 from 12.30 pm to 3 pm.

  • The cost to participate is $15/ person, $80/ team of six, or $100/ team of eight. 
  • Each team will consist of 6-8 players
  • Players must be 18+ (in order to sign XL Sports World's waiver) or 16+ ONLY if a parent/guardian is present at the event and signs the waiver for the participant.
  • Check in for players will be from 12.30 pm-1 pm
  • Game play will be from 1 pm-3 pm 
  • Each perk includes the cost of participation to play and some include food and/or drinks.
  • Food, drinks, beer, and raffle tickets will also be sold at the event.
  • No St. Patty's day celebration is complete without a drink! Please bring your ID if you plan to purchase alcohol. The most expensive is only $5 for a 24 oz draft.
  • Raffle prizes will be given away by random draw at the end of the event.
  • Participants must enroll through this site by March 12, 2014 or by making special arrangements through me, Sydney Levan, by the same date.
  • Though game play ends at 3pm, participants and spectators are invited to stay longer to enjoy the festivities among friends
  • One field at the facility will be for dodge ball, the other field will be set up with a moon bounce and soccer balls for free play, in other words, bring the kids!

Participants may register as an individual or by team. Prior to the event, I will send out an email to those who have signed up to find out what team they will be participating with and what they would like their team name to be. If you want to play but do not have enough people for a team, please register as an individual and I will make a team for you.

Please email me at sydlev1@gmail.com if you have any further questions about the event or would like more information before signing up.

The Impact:

Traveling to Australia has always been a dream of mine, but the obvious factors of time, money, and anticipation have held me back. With this opportunity, I would not only be able to travel to "the land down under," but I would also be able to add a tremendous experience to my resume as a pre-medical student that will help me stand out on my application to medical school. 

I have proved that I am dedicated in my studies and will benefit greatly through this program by the following achievements:

  • Maintained a 3.8 GPA over 79 credits of coursework
  • Inducted into the honors society for two year colleges, Phi Theta Kappa (http://www.ptk.org/)
  • Inducted into the honors program at VCU (http://honors.vcu.edu/index.html)
  • Student volunteer at VCU Medical Center and the SciKids program at VCU (https://vcu.collegiatelink.net/organization/scikids)
  • Worked continuously throughout college to pay for tuition while taking full-time course load

Some highlights of the trip include:

  • Exploration of Christchurch, New Zealand; Sydney, Australia; and Port Douglas, Australia through guided tours, museums, and free time
  • A comprehensive look at New Zealand's health care system and the principles of universal health care
  • Study of emergency medicine during natural disasters
  • Study of bush medicine in the Outback
  • Study of tropical infectious diseases and pathogens unique to Australia
  • Historic tour of Sydney, Australia and the original Sydney town settlement
  • A visit to the University of New South Wales to study organ and tissue preservation and advances in research
  • Snorkeling of the Great Barrier Reef, a Kuranda rainforest tour, visits to several culture parks
  • http://www.scholarlaureate.org/programs/delegation-medicine-australia.html

I am asking you, my family and friends, to help me see my hard work through and make this dream come true. I am truly appreciative for everybody who has helped me get to this point and those who have encouraged me and been a friend along the way. Thank you for your support and for believing in me.

Quick Facts:

- XL Sports World's Address: 2300 Oak Lake Blvd, Midlothian, VA

- Date/time: Saturday, March 15, 2014 from 12.30pm to 3pm

- Beer available for sale:

  • Draft: Bud Lite, Michelob Ultra, Heineken, Red Hook, DB Vienna Lager, Legend's Brown Ale, Bold Rock Apple Cider, Hardywood Singel
  • Bottle/can: Seagrams, But Lite bottle, Coors Lite, Amstel Lite, Yuengling, Miller Lite, Corona, John Smith's, Guinness, Redbridge, Bud Lite Lime-a-Rita and Straw-ber-rita

- Ways to contact me: 804-456-2201 or sydlev1@gmail.com (email is preferred)

Other Ways You Can Help

A big thank you to everyone for coming to my page and showing your support! I do understand that not everyone will be able to make it or does not like to play dodge ball. For the former, I have set up a perk that allows you to donate to the fund, without being a participant. For the latter, participation is not required to come to the event; please come and hang out and have a good time for St. Patty's Day weekend!

For those who cannot/ do not wish to contribute, thank you for your time and please pass the word on of the event to those you think may be interested!

My goal for this fundraiser is to raise the $1,800 needed for airfare while having a great time for my 21st birthday and St. Patrick's Day with my friends, family, and supporters. I have set the goal at $500 as that was the minimum required by the site. The site will take a higher percentage of the funds raised if you do not meet your goal, so I thought $500 was a safe number that I could reach.If my goal is reached, any remaining funds will go directly to the cost of tuition, which I am paying for using the last of my student loan money. If my goal is not reached, the remaining needed will come out of my personal savings account. The Event:I thought that a great way to get everybody together for a social event/fundraiser was to host a dodge ball tournament! The event will be held at XL Sports World (formerly RISE) on their indoor turf fields on March 15, 2014 from 12.30 pm to 3 pm. 
The cost to participate is $15/ person, $80/ team of six, or $100/ team of eight.  

Each team will consist of 6-8 players 

Players must be 18+ (in order to sign XL Sports World's waiver) or 16+ ONLY if a parent/guardian is present at the event and signs the waiver for the participant.
Check in for players will be from 12.30 pm-1 pm
Game play will be from 1 pm-3 pm  

Each perk includes the cost of participation to play and some include food and/or drinks.

Food, drinks, beer, and raffle tickets will also be sold at the event.
No St. Patty's day celebration is complete without a drink! Please bring your ID if you plan to purchase alcohol. The most expensive is only $5 for a 24 oz draft. 

Raffle prizes will be given away by random draw at the end of the event.

Participants must enroll through this site by March 12, 2014 or by making special arrangements through me, Sydney Levan, by the same date. 

Though game play ends at 3pm, participants and spectators are invited to stay longer to enjoy the festivities among friends
One field at the facility will be for dodge ball, the other field will be set up with a moon bounce and soccer balls for free play, in other words, bring the kids!
Participants may register as an individual or by team. Prior to the event, I will send out an email to those who have signed up to find out what team they will be participating with and what they would like their team name to be. If you want to play but do not have enough people for a team, please register as an individual and I will make a team for you. Please email me at sydlev1@gmail.com if you have any further questions about the event or would like more information before signing up. The Impact:Traveling to Australia has always been a dream of mine, but the obvious 
factors of time, money, and anticipation have held me back. With this 
opportunity, I would not only be able to travel to "the land down 
under," but I would also be able to add a tremendous experience to my 
resume as a pre-medical student that will help me stand out on my 
application to medical school. I have proved that I am dedicated in my studies and will benefit greatly through this program by the following achievements:
Maintained a 3.8 GPA over 79 credits of coursework

Inducted into the honors society for two year colleges, Phi Theta Kappa (http://www.ptk.org/) 

Inducted into the honors program at VCU (http://honors.vcu.edu/index.html)
Student volunteer at VCU Medical Center and the SciKids program at VCU (https://vcu.collegiatelink.net/organization/scikids)

Worked continuously throughout college to pay for tuition while taking full-time course load
Some highlights of the trip include:
Exploration of Christchurch, New Zealand; Sydney, Australia; and Port Douglas, Australia through guided tours, museums, and free time

A comprehensive look at New Zealand's health care system and the principles of universal health care

Study of emergency medicine during natural disasters
Study of bush medicine in the Outback
Study of tropical infectious diseases and pathogens unique to Australia

Historic tour of Sydney, Australia and the original Sydney town settlement
A visit to the University of New South Wales to study organ and tissue preservation and advances in research
Snorkeling of the Great Barrier Reef, a Kuranda rainforest tour, visits to several culture parks
http://www.scholarlaureate.org/programs/delegation-medicine-australia.html
I am asking you, my family and friends, to help me see my hard work through and make this dream come true. I am truly appreciative for everybody who has helped me get to this point and those who have encouraged me and been a friend along the way. Thank you for your support and for believing in me. Quick Facts:- XL Sports World's Address: 2300 Oak Lake Blvd, Midlothian, VA- Date/time: Saturday, March 15, 2014 from 12.30pm to 3pm- Beer available for sale: 
Draft: Bud Lite, Michelob Ultra, Heineken, Red Hook, DB Vienna Lager, Legend's Brown Ale, Bold Rock Apple Cider, Hardywood Singel 

Bottle/can: Seagrams, But Lite bottle, Coors Lite, Amstel Lite, Yuengling, Miller Lite, Corona, John Smith's, Guinness, Redbridge, Bud Lite Lime-a-Rita and Straw-ber-rita

- Ways to contact me: 804-456-2201 or sydlev1@gmail.com (email is preferred) Other Ways You Can Help 
A big thank you to everyone for coming to my page and showing your support! I do understand that not everyone will be able to make it or does not like to play dodge ball. For the former, I have set up a perk that allows you to donate to the fund, without being a participant. For the latter, participation is not required to come to the event; please come and hang out and have a good time for St. Patty's Day weekend!For those who cannot/ do not wish to contribute, thank you for your time and please pass the word on of the event to those you think may be interested!

story:
Long Story Short

We have a big vision to implement a nationwide curriculum to get young people tapped into their passion and purpose, enhance their self esteem, develop confidence, leadership and entrepreneurial skills and take full responsibility for creating a life full of success, happiness and fulfillment. 

Our vision is based on Jack Canfield's (author of the Chicken Soup for the Soul series) Success Principles work. The vision is gaining some huge momentum, has attracted some powerful collaborative partners and we are getting ready to take the next steps!

We have put together an amazing team of seven young people, ranging in age from 15 to 24, to train with Jack at his Breakthrough to Success live event in August, so they can, in turn train peers, teachers, and youth service providers in this transformational work! The ultimate vision is to work with national partners to bring this work to schools across the country ... And the wheels are already turning to make that happen!

We already have the tuition covered for the team. We just need to raise the funds to cover travel and related expenses.

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $11,000 to cover the costs associated with attending the training, including:

  • Transportation from RI, NH and ME to AZ - planes, trains, and automobiles 
  • Baggage fees
  • Hotel Accommodations
  • Meals
  • Gratuity (for the people who serve us along the way!)

We are doing lots of local fundraising, grant writing and private solicitation to support this trip as well as the larger vision, so any extra funds we raise will go directly towards the continuation of curriculum development and implementation. 

The White Mountain Community Health Center is a 501c3 non-profit, so all your contributions are tax deductible. If you are moved by our vision please donate today! 

If you are familiar with Jack's work and/or have attended any of his training or coaching events, I am sure you have found yourself wondering what your life would have been like if you had been practicing the success principles before you even graduated from high school? You can help make that happen for the next generation by contributing today!

Any and all amounts will help us get from where we are to where we're going and are greatly appreciated!

If you need more information, read on or contact Trisha directly at trisharx@aol.com

By attending this training, the youth team will experience first hand the power of proven success principles, techniques and tools, discover their own passions and purpose, and will stand ready to help us begin implementing the Pathways to Success Youth Vision for peers, educators and youth service providers as early as Fall 2014.

Who We Are

Trisha Jacobson, is a teen expert, teacher, coach, mentor, best selling author, and 2012 graduate of Jack Canfield's elite Success Principles Train The Trainer program and currently serves on Jack's training team. She coordinates the Teen Clinic and Community Outreach Programs at White Mountain Community Health Center. She is passionate about helping young people take 100% responsibility for their choices and creating a vision based on passion and purpose and teaching them skills and tools to help them set goals, develop an entrepreneurial mindset, and action and accountability planning that lead to success.

Mikayla Cerney is a student in Jack's 2014 Train the Trainer class, works as the Lead Peer Educator at the White Mountain Community Health Center Teen Clinic and serves as the Pathways to Success Team Leader.

Both Trish and Mikayla are amazed at the impact Jack's work has had on their own lives and on the young people they serve since they began using the principles in clinic and classroom settings in 2010.  They are excited about the potential the success principles can offer young people as they grow into their own futures! 

Meet our other youth team members ... Faith, Marianna, Grace, Meg, and Marissa ... by viewing the team video in the Gallery section.

Other Ways You Can Help

Send us a digital HUG or HIGH FIVE (whichever is your style) by helping spread the word!

Share our campaign link on your own website or timeline https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pathways-to-success-youth-project/x/7318955

Buy a Positivity Bracelet for $10! (Picture located in Gallery section.) A great reminder to keep negativity in check while supporting a great cause! https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=X4APZHX5WCQBA

Like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Teen-Clinic-at-White-Mountain-Community-Health-Center/143662842351818

The Longer Story

Do you wish that you could discover what you are wildly passionate about and build your life around it? Have you already discovered your passion and wish that you could have know sooner in order to have lived a life that was more "on purpose"?

Do you know a young person (or a young at heart person) who is bored, unmotivated or lacking self esteem, self confidence and a clear vision for their future? 

Trisha Jacobson is a teen expert, teacher, coach, mentor and best selling author who has worked with teens and young adults in academic and health care setting for over twenty years. She currently coordinates the Teen Clinic, Community Outreach Education and Project Connect Peer Education programs at White Mountain Community Health Center in Conway, NH. Her County has the very lowest teen pregnancy rate in the country and she is proud of the work she and her team are doing to support that fact.

Over the years of working with young people, she has noticed that limiting beliefs and lack of clarity around passion, purpose, life vision and goals often lead to lack of motivation, decreased academic engagement and increased risk behavior and life changing consequences, including substance use and unintended pregnancy.

When Trisha was first introduced to Jack's work at a live event in August 2010, she was at a crossroads and considering a career change. But after the first day of the event, instead of planning her own future, she found herself going back to her hotel room after a long day in the training room, unable to sleep, inspired and enthusiastically writing new curriculum for her fall classes and incorporating Jack's success principles into her lesson plans. As she realized how powerful subconscious limiting beliefs are in blocking us from what we want to accomplish in life, she began to see the connection between her work with young people and how they could benefit from mastering the power of beliefs to create the life of their dreams. This continued for the entire seven days of the event! Trisha knew in her heart and soul that she was onto something.

Jack Canfield has been teaching the principles outlined in his book, Success Principles: How to Get From Where You Are to Where You Want to Be, to adults interested in personal development, leadership development and business success for many years and participants have been breaking through blocks, reframing limiting beliefs, learning how to use the power of their subconscious mind and heart to create the life of their dreams while getting profound results along with increased joy and happiness. 

Why aren't we teaching these principles to our young people, Trisha wondered. On the final day of the event, Trisha knew she was not alone. In his closing remarks, Jack stated his desire to get back to his teaching roots and get back to the classroom with his success principles work. In that moment, Trisha knew she would be helping Jack do just that.

In September of 2010 Trisha began incorporating the principles into her health classes and in 2011/2012, she implemented a pilot curriculum in middle and high school health classrooms as well as her clinic's peer education training program.

In 2013/2014, she developed a larger vision to bring this work across the United States and beyond. She began to explore collaborative partnerships with key stakeholders on state, regional and national levels, several of which are now in process. 

The next immediate step is training a team of young people to help bring the curriculum, which is currently being developed, nationwide by beginning to train teachers, youth service providers, parents and youth leaders in the model.

The Impact

Here's what Trisha says about this project ...

"This project is so exciting! Did you know that studies indicate that 50% of adults in the US don't enjoy their work? Imagine a world where everyone was in line with their passion and life purpose; their reason for being here on the planet. This work has the potential to accomplish that ideal in our youth.

Jack's success principles provide a framework to help students take 100% responsibility for their thoughts, words and actions and reframe limiting beliefs and habits that don't serve them in achieving ultimate success and fulfillment. 

This work helps to improve academic engagement, enhance motivation, support students in connecting with their unique purpose and their vision of personal success and so they can reach their fullest potential. 

I see huge application in supporting decision making around risk behavior, thus reducing unintended pregnancy, enhancing academic success, and reducing substance use in young people. The success principles provides a framework for success along with the tools to eliminate limiting beliefs as they learn to harness the power of their subconscious mind to supercharge the achievement of their goals and clear the way to taking the action that will get them wherever they want to go and achieve whatever they want to achieve.

At the same time, Jack's Success Principles teach practical tools, skills and the mindset necessary for entrepreneurial success, which are critical to prepare students for today's workplace, job market and entrepreneurial opportunities they will face as they transition from school to career."

Click here to learn more about Trisha and what she's up to.

Click here to learn more about Jack's Breakthrough to Success event! We'd love to have you join us in August!

story:
Hello. I'm a seventh grade student, in Tucson, AZ. I need to raise 100 dollars so that I can go on a few community building trips with the Middle School. We are going to a place called Walking Jay farm, and later in the spring we will go on a different trip, to Patagonia.

          Please help me enrich my learning experience by donating a money to my indie-go-go campaign. If many people donate only three of four dollars, I can reach my goal, and go on the trips. I might even be able to help my classmates reach their goals. If you donate, you will receive perks ranging from coloring books, to T-shirts, and help me at the same time. Thanks. I knew I could count on you to help me.

story:
Short Summary

In today's world, public schools are struggling  to meet their funding challenges.  In efforts to back fill some budgeting shortfalls, we are here, and in addition to we are holding a Pine Valley Middle School Pancake Breakfast for the Arts on May 10th. to help meet our needs and to help continue to grow our great Performing and Visual Arts program and educational needs at Pine Valley Middle School. 

What You Get

Your purchases and donations will help our  Visual and Performing Arts programs to fuel young creative minds.

The Breakdown:

  • Calendars, We are currently running a contest to feature art work from our Visual Art and Design classes. Voting will take place at the Pancake Feed.  Winners will be put in a 12 or 18 month calendar, available for purchase.  All monies will go towards supplies needed or wanted for the Visual and Performing Arts Departments.
  • Pancake Tickets, With the purchase of tickets, it will help fund the Performing Arts at PVMS.  This year there was a large shortfall on our annual field trip to perform at Disneyland. Your donation will help to back fill the Pine Valley Middle School's Education Foundation's over extended budget.  
  • Other monies will go towards the purchase of sheet music.  We are big advocators  of purchasing the proper amount of sheet music to continually support music art, for all musicians. We don't believe in photo copying the music, putting composers at risk.
  • All of the donations go to our students.  Our Education Foundation is 100% volunteer run.

The Impact

Your donations will go a long way in reaching those Middle School children that thrive by expressing themselves in the visual and performance arts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Volunteer at our Pancake Feed May 10th.

story:
Hi, my name is Autumn and I'm a Sophomore Visual Communications student specializing in design at Texas A&M University-Commerce. After graduation, my ultimate dream is to eventually have my own graphic design company. There are many opportunities for most of the majors at my school to study abroad every year, but, every other year, my department joins with USM (University of Southern Mississippi) for the opportunity to travel to London, England to study at Kings College London. The program is called the British Studies Program and lasts for a month during the summer. I'm currently working on obtaining a scholarship, but while a scholarship will help, it will only cover a small portion of the tuition. 

The amount that I need to be raised will help pay for tuition, airfare, housing, transportation, required museum visits, theater events, required academic excursions, and many other academic activities. This cost will also help pay for any supplies that I will need, meals, and travel expenses that will come up during the time of traveling to the other two European countries required for independent exploration. 

During this trip, I will be traveling to London, England, Paris, France, and two other undecided European countries to learn about graphic design and its influence on culture. We will have daily tours to major sites, museums and neighborhoods as well as on-site visits to studios and agencies to learn about their design thinking and creative process. We will also be doing research on historic design at various institutions and libraries. 

I think I’ll learn a lot of things about graphic design, its history, and the process of finding creativity through this program as well as personal growth. I also think I’ll gain a lot of connections through this program especially since it brings many universities together and it’s in a different country. 

So in the end I am asking for help through donations to help me raise money to further my education in the Graphic Design field. I am really excited about the outcome of this experience. Even if it's just $10 that you're donating, it will help. It would also help to spread this around so that the word can get out and so that I can get even more donations. Thank you for your time!

story:
Our Story

OccupyMNTV's mission is to bring the public accurate and authentic representational images of Occupy Minneapolis and the Occupy Movement in Minnesota. It's entirely volunteer run and has been operating almost exclusively with one camera and one computer since November of 2012.

 

Videography and editing take considerable effort and time, but in spite of its remarkably limited resources, OccupyMNTV's videos have reached a wide audience and have been featured on local news, Occupy Wall Street's facebook page, ThinkProgress, The Huffington Post, and MSNBC.

There's quite a bit going on, and it's becoming evident that coverage of Occupy Minneapolis and the Occupy Movement in Minnesota could be much more comprehensive.

There's an excess of creativity and activity around here, and a shortage of the technology necessary to allow the activities to be creatively and truthfully covered. This campaign aims to ensure the chronicling of this important and unprecedented moment.

 

Subscribe to OccupyMNTV on Youtube

Follow OccupyMNTV on facebook

OccupyMNTV on Huffington Post

OccupyMNTV on ThinkProgress
OccupyMNTV and Occupy Homes MN featured on Rachel Maddow




The Impact

A movement is only as strong as its ability to represent itself, and with each day that passes, important historical moments slip through the cracks and are left only to be remembered by those who witnessed them firsthand. We can't depend on the corporate media to represent us truthfully, and in order to ensure these pivotal events are properly presented to the people and chronicled for posterity, we need your support. Every dollar donated to OccupyMNTV will increase the depth, breadth, and quality of our coverage.


The Occupy Homes movement is rapidly developing, and Minneapolis has been leading the charge. With the victory of Bobby Hull (explained in the video above) demonstrating that communities can organize and hold the banks accountable to the people their policies and decisions affect, the stakes have been raised. The quality of coverage of the events of the ensuing months will have a profound impact on the lives of several Minnesota families who are facing foreclosure. Click here to learn about Occupy Homes Minnesota's ongoing campaign to save Monique White's home.


Furthermore, by donating to OccupyMNTV, you're not only helping to save important historical moments from obscurity, assisting in the fight against economic inequality, and helping keep Minnesota families in their homes; you're also contributing to the production of an eventual feature length documentary about the Occupy Movement in Minneapolis. 


What We Need & What You Get


All proceeds will be used to purchase audiovisual equipment (starting with a second camera, followed by a second computer, and an audio recorder) that will make it possible for more volunteers to contribute to OccupyMNTV's creative coverage of the movement as it develops in Minnesota. We want to do as much as we can to make OccupyMNTV a lean, mean videojournalistic machine in time for major events planned for May 1st.


Other Ways You Can Help

Let your friends know the Occupy Movement is persisting and evolving, and having real effects in peoples' lives. Tell them about Occupy Homes and how communities can band together to keep people in their homes and fight back against economic injustice. If you're a videographer or video editor in Minnesota who's interested in assisting us, email OccupyMNTV@gmail.com.


Or donate directly to Occupy Homes MN.


To learn more about Occupy Minneapolis, visit OccupyMinneapolis.mn

 

Or be courageous and peruse the Occupy Minneapolis Events Calendar until you find an event that suits your interests and get out and get involved!
story_txt:
Our Story
OccupyMNTV's mission is to bring the public accurate and authentic representational images of Occupy Minneapolis and the Occupy Movement in Minnesota. It's entirely volunteer run and has been operating almost exclusively with one camera and one computer since November of 2012.
 
 Videography and editing take considerable effort and time, but in spite of its remarkably limited resources, OccupyMNTV's videos have reached a wide audience and have been featured on local news, Occupy Wall Street's facebook page, ThinkProgress, The Huffington Post, and MSNBC. There's quite a bit going on, and it's becoming evident that coverage of Occupy Minneapolis and the Occupy Movement in Minnesota could be much more comprehensive.  There's an excess of creativity and activity around here, and a shortage of the technology necessary to allow the activities to be creatively and truthfully covered. This campaign aims to ensure the chronicling of this important and unprecedented moment.

story:
Our Story

The Hope Community Center is an incredible organization founded to work directly with the refugees to try to break through a serious barrier by teaching English as a Second Language, offering music lessons, and holding sports activities to bring everybody together to share experiences and knowledge. They believe in communal opportunity and are doing anything that they can to benefit and empower each individual and youth that needs assistance.

This Thanksgiving, they will be hosting a dinner celebration for all of the friends and families supported by the Hope Community Center. They have asked the Orlando community to get involved in raising money for this project and celebrate each individuals successes they have made with the help of the Hope Community Center. We applaud and encourage their work and we hope that you will also be encouraged and empowered to support an organization that is doing it right!


The Impact

We want every family that has come to the Hope Community Center to truly have an unforgettable Thanksgiving feast with their families and friends.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $500 by November 21st in order to contribute in raising funds for this amazing feast!


Other Ways You Can Help

You can Volunteer!! Please, feel free to be a part of this project and serve. The more, the merrier! Contact us at Nataliahoyo@gmail.com if you would like to volunteer!

story:
This is Me

 

I am a twenty year old college student who attended Drew University. Running into financial trouble for two semesters, I decided to transfer to Kutztown University. Already accepted and starting the process, all I need to keep costs down is transportation. What I need is a car. It's not easy to get a car when you're supporting yourself. Currently I take the bus system to get everywhere I need to go, but having a car is something that is needed here because Kutztown isn't accesible through any public transportation system here in Reading, PA. 

I wish for everything to go back and learn, and for something like a lack of transportation to hold me back, kills me. Living on campus would just increase costs for me, and will keep me from keeping the amazing and stable job at a doctor's office I have secured.

 

How could you help?

  • Donating ANY amount
  • Sharing this among your social network accounts
  • Spreading the word between friends and family

 

All I need is a small car, something to get me there and back. No fancy stereo system, no added luxuries. I just need something to get my life back on track so I can graduate and feel secure about my future.

story:
Please help if you want to assist me in returning to REED College for my Junior year..

 I am a 2011 graduate of Estacada High School in Oregon. I was Salutatorian of my High School class earning a scholarship to REED College. I have been attending Reed for the last 2 years majoring in Biology.

 With the passing of my great-grandmother (who's greatest wish was for me to complete school) and recent foreclosure on our home my immediate family is unable to pull funds and help at this time.  

 I find myself in DIRE need of additional financial assistance to continue my studies.

 I have been able to earn 95% of my tuition via scholarships, loans, and working. I owe a remainder of 4000 dollars for tuition, medical insurance, & book fees that is needed before the school year begins.

 I work part time at a kennel and recently had to take time off after one our sweet canine guests infected a couple of us workers.

With no other options for earning the needed funds, I am appealing to all who are willing to invest in my future!

 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My grandfather is offering his "baby", a 1968 Pontiac Catalina 4 dr/2 barrel/400 engine, with only 38,600 miles, to anyone local to Portland that is offering $1300 or more to my cause.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 Thank you for taking the time to read my plea. If you are unable to help financially, please forward on my request to help fulfill my campaign. 

<3

Thank you

story:
My story: 

I am Naren Krishna, a young and passionate entrepreneur from Hyderabad, India. I am currently pursuing Pre-final year of undergrad in Chemistry at BITS Pilani Hyderabad Campus. I am strongly passionate about entrepreneurship and building new ventures right from my freshman year of undergrad. 

Too meet my passion I started my first venture Inc42 when I was 18 years old. Inc42 is a social platform for young startups (even in the idea stage), to interact and flourish with a passionate community. Within the first six months itself we have worked with many startups as well as Big players and Incubators in India. Yes, the media loves us too. We have been featured in various online and offline newspaper for the amazing work we put up. 

I have also represented the country at various platforms like Global Entrepreneurship Summer School, Munich; World Business Dialogue ; Global Social Business Summit. 

Apart from Entrepreneurship I am a avid traveler. Being a freelancing photographer helped me travel various places. I believe travelling is a form of learning because it exposes (or can expose) a person to cultures other than one's own and to places that have historical or cultural significance. 

So far so good. Now how do I actually blend my passions Travelling & Entrepreneurship. Well, I am currently working on an idea called Yowander! 

A tour maker. An experience sharer. Yowander is the platform to make the best and customized tours at cheap price through our contest platform for travel agencies and tell travel takes. You get the best at the cheapest. It’s fancy. It’s economic. It’s a time-saver. 


Draper University: 

I have been recently selected to attend Draper University's 7 week entrepreneurship program starting 20th January 2014. Draper University was started by Tim Draper - one of the most reputed Venture Capitalist in Silicon Valley who has identified and invested in disruptive companies like Hotmail, Skype. Draper University would help me shape my venture and take it to the next level. Being mentored by seasoned entrepreneurs would help me become a successful entrepreneur. Below is the sample curriculum for seven weeks. 

This 7 week program organised by Draper University offers intense training to build critical skills and optimal mental framework to embark on a high impact entrepreneurial journey. People who teach at Draper University are experts from the industry, successful entrepreneurs and VCs which enables tremendous hands on learning. Some of the past speakers include leaders like Elon Musk, Andy Tang, Ron Johnson, Bill Campbell, Bob Metcalfe and has some of the best mentors like Tina Seelig. Draper University is located in the heart of silicon valley and hence will give me access to some of the best technologists, inventors, investors and entrepreneurs. This program gives me a chance to become a successful entrepreneur.  



What I Need:Breakup of the total funding I need is below:

Tuition: $5500
Travel: $1500
Living Expenses: $1000
Amount to be raised: $ 7500
Even if I do not reach the entire goal, all the funds raised here would be used to fund my tuition and travel to participate in Draper University.

Other Ways You Can Help:Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please help me get the word out about this campaign in your network.
  • You can use some of the Indiegogo share tools!
  • A big Thank You for the share :)

story:
What if Steve Jobs never got a chance to work with computers? Instead he was forced to memorize acronyms of computer models. What if Michelangelo never worked with sculpting tools? Instead he was forced to only regurgitate facts about art history.

   

It is currently 1:34 PM in Canada. Instead of shaping the world like these greats, I am stuck in school listening to my teacher read off 57 slides about the history of the programming language C.

I want to be the next Larry Page, the mastermind of Google. But as the clock ticks steadily away, I feel like I'm running on a treadmill. My feet are moving, and I'm exerting an incredible amount of energy, but I've gone nowhere. 1.3 kilometers later, and I'm back where I began.

Do you feel the same way? A lot of students do.

What does LINX do?

Envision a society in which every student makes the right choice regarding college or university on the first try. Wherein students are adequately exposed to career opportunities from an early age and are actively engaged in that they actually care about.

Imagine an ecosystem in which small to large corporations can directly engage their future employees in school, tap into an immense pool of talent to solve pressing global issues, and contribute something of significant value back to their communities.

This is a utopia that we have not reached, but can work towards achieving. 

LINX is an organization that will revolutionize the education system and transform the traditional classroom setting into a dynamic 21st century learning environment by stressing application-based learning in the classroom in a way that directly involves private industry rather than government investment. By distancing ourselves from the sensitive issue of government spending of tax-payers money, we’ll be able to take the calculated risks necessary as an organization to drive the education system forward.

Our value proposition rests upon 3 customer segments – teachers, students, industry. By bringing together these stakeholders, specifically industry and teachers, we will collaboratively develop applicable real-world projects at the high school level to be distributed to classrooms across Ontario at semi-semester intervals in a competition format. In doing so, we will be able to drive student engagement through competition.

Projects will be delivered via two (2) installments of interactive videos per semester made in collaboration between teachers and industry and expose students to career opportunities and industry specific information that they can use for their post-secondary pursuits.

Having already secured verbal commitments from various teachers in the region, we’re on track to begin our primary product-development phase in first semester of 2013-2014 for two schools in Halton District School Board. Following this initial testing phase, we then plan on carrying out a beta-testing phase in second semester and have a perfected model of project development by the end of the first year. We intend on expanding to multiple school boards across Ontario, and then Canada and beyond.

Press Release:

 

About the Team:

Eisha Ahmed is a grade 12 student at Abbey Park High School. She is a Loran Scholar (2013), two-time Intel ISEF Finalist (2012 & 2013) and aspiring professor who will be studying at McGill University in the Fall.

Manjot Sangha is a grade 12 student at Iroquois Ridge High School. He is an Intel ISEF Finalist (2012), International Biology Olympiad Finalist (2013) and will be attending McGill University in the Fall.

Dennis Xu is a grade 12 student at Abbey Park High School. He is an Intel ISEF Finalist (2012), the co-founder and CEO of the Organization of Ontario Secondary Students (OOSS) and an aspiring ed-tech entrepreneur. He will be attending Stanford University in the Fall.

Jason Xie is a grade 12 student at William Lyon Mackenzie High School with an affinity for technology and software development. He has worked on various education-based projects in the past - one of which is being used as enrichment material for the Grade 3 Ontario curriculum. He will be attending the University of Toronto in the Fall.

story:
About Me

I am Jennifer Grube and I am an educator, mentor, and community volunteer. My friends describe me as witty, kooky, kind, and generous - they are right. :) I work with students ages 4 - college graduates. Here's a snapshot of my current employment (all current positions):

  • Sandcastle Preschool Lead Teacher, 10 years
  • Philomath Outdoor School Director, 12 years
  • Philomath High School Cheer Coach, 4 years (volunteer position)

I am an avid advocate of education - primarily, convincing students to INVEST in their education. I have a diversity of teaching experience from fostering social and academic development in preschool age children, to working in credit recovery classrooms, to mentoring college students as they become teachers. I am very passionate about public education and feel very passionate about education reform that keeps students best interests at heart. 

Educator Tour: Dominican Republic

Last year, I was able to chaparone high school students on a global perspectives tour to the Dominican Republic. The purpose of the tour was to expose students to different cultures, poverty, and human rights issues. I cannot describe the impact this project had on me as a human and an educator. I also got to see the impact the trip had on the students I traveled with. We had the rare opportunity to visit two Bateys, a Batey relief clinic, an orphanage for children with HIV, a local dump, and a free trade factory. There were several heart tugging moments for all of us and it was an invaluable experience for all involved.

This year, I have been invited to return to the Dominican Republic as part of a limited group of educators. It will be an eight day collaborative experience centered on the theme of global education. I will have the opportunity to meet with local teachers, community activists, NGO’s, and Dominican citizens working to improve the lives of those living in extreme poverty. I will get to collaborate to create classroom activities and materials that will prepare students to live in an increasingly globalized, interdependent world, and to be active citizens in shaping a better future.

Financial Need

A grant will cover half of my accommodations while I am in the Dominican Republic, but I am responsible for the remaining half as well as travel expenses. These expenses total about $1500. Any amount toward my fundraising goal will be so very appreciated.

Impact

Traveling to the Dominican Republic last year changed my life. It was incredibly powerful to witnessn extreme poverty, diverse culture and students' personal and global perspectives change in a positively radical way. Being able to bring some of that perspective back to the classroom will be invaluable to student learning.

This experience does not simply aim to impart knowledge and skills, but to promote positive values, such as a commitment to opposing poverty and injustice, affirming human rights and cultural diversity, seeking a peaceful and just world and working towards environmental sustainability. I cannot wait to pass that wisdom onto students.

Other Ways You Can Help

I believe in the power of positive thinking! So, if you are unable to support me financially, think a REALLY positive thought about me reaching my goal. :)

This experience does not simply aim to impart knowledge and skills, but to promote positive values, such as a commitment to opposing poverty and injustice, affirming human rights and cultural diversity, seeking a peaceful and just world and working towards environmental sustainability. I cannot wait to pass that wisdom onto students.
Other Ways You Can Help
I believe in the power of positive thinking! So, if you are unable to support me financially, think a REALLY positive thought about me reaching my goal. :)

story:
Dear Friends and Family:
How are you doing? I hope that God is doing as many wonderful things in your life as He is in mine. I just completed a wonderful year at Indiana Wesleyan, and am sensing God's will to do more for the world around me.
I want to share with you a challenging ministry opportunity that God has presented to me. From July 20 through July 26, God has offered me the chance to go to Talamanca, Costa Rica, with a small group. This 6 day missions trip will involve construction and relational ministry. We will be reaching out and spreading the gospel to the Costa Rican people while also learning more about the people there and their culture.
While God has opened up a door for me to develop a greater heart of compassion for His people around the world, the exciting part is that you will be able to share in this compassion in several ways. First, you can help pray for me and my fellow travelers. We will need prayers that God will prepare us for our visit and bless our efforts as we minister to the people of Costa Rica. We will also need prayers that our financial needs will be met. At this time we need to raise $1,500 each to attend this trip, and that is quite a challenge!
Another way you can be involved is to help provide that financial support. Would you consider supporting me with a small donation? I will need to raise all my funds in order to pay for airline tickets and other items. Whether you feel led to contribute financially, through prayer, or both, all of your support is appreciated.
I look forward to doing God's work in Costa Rica and letting you know all about how God has worked through this team when I return in July. Thank you so much for your support!
God Bless,
Allie Alayan

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sri Ananta Yogi.  About two years ago, I met Swami Shivananda Giri, who is responsible for guiding me to the yogic lineage to which I now belong and for introducing me to our now mutual Guru.  Swami-ji has played a pivotal role in the most transformational journey of my life.  He has helped open my heart to a universe of boundless love, joy, and bliss. 

This coming July, on Guru Purnima, another student of Swami's, (Sri Brahmachari Ganesh) and I, will both be consecrated Swamis ourselves, by our Guru, His Holiness Mahamandaleshwar Paramahamsa Swarupananda Vishwa Guru Maharaj Swamiji.  We would not be here if it were not for Swami Shivananda Giri.  We would like for him to be able to make the trip from Charleston, IL, to sit at our consecration, which will take place at the Malibu Hindu Temple in Southern CA.  

This is no trivial or insignificant event.  It represents the formal decision and vows to renounce lifetimes of conditioned identification with the world, and with self-gratification, in favor of a lifetime of selfless service devoted solely to GOD.  Since Swami-ji has played such an important part in bringing us to this point, it seems only fitting that he should attend.  Furthermore, this may be Swami-ji's last opportunity to physically sit at the Guru's feet before moving to a new ashram in Belize.  

This has the potential to be a monumentally potent event, on many levels, for all parties involved.  It is my sincere and humble wish for Swami-ji, who has given me so much, to share this experience with Ganesh, our Guru, and me.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are estimating the necessary funds at approximately $900

  • Swami's roundtrip airfare is going to cost about $570.  
  • For him to sit at the fire ceremony will cost $302, paid to the temple and the priests. 
  • We will also need approximately $100 to cover his shuttle costs, to and from the airport and, potentially, a rent-a-car for the day of the ceremony.
  • Swami's lodging and food expenses are already covered (I will be hosting him).

In honor of your generosity, we would like to point out the perks, both implicit in your service, as well as some tangible gifts as a token of our appreciation.

Any service rendered to holy men/women constitutes meritirious action: specifically karma yoga.  As any little bit helps, you can rest assured that your heartfelt donation - no matter how big or small - tips the scales of the universe that much further in the direction of your heightened consciousness and ultimate enlightenment/liberation. 

Donations at the $25 level will each receive a scriptural anecdote, ranging from a couple of sentences to a paragraph, intuitively hand-selected just for you, and accompanied by a special energetic blessing.

Donations at or above the $100 level will receive a 12+1 large-bead rudraksha seed wrist mala.  Strung by me and blessed by Swami Shivananda Giri, specifically for you.

If we should fail to meet our goal, funds will go to completing as much of our objective as possible with the funds that are available.  For example, if the cost of airfare is met but the cost of Swami's presence at the ceremony is not, we will still fly him out to participate in satsang with our Guru and in the celebration associated with the consecration event and the Guru Purnima holiday.

 

The Impact

Those of us who seriously devote our energy to an enlightenment practice believe that our liberation from erroneous mental conditioning, and our corresponding enlightenment, is the greatest gift that we can bestow upon humanity.  For every one of us that realizes that level of consciousness that is completely uncoloured by any sense of separation, the very vibratory state of the world itself is raised.  This event is one that has been deemed particularly auspicious toward the end of furthering that pursuit - by the grace of the Guru  - for three of the yogis of this lineage.  We, in turn, are ultimately empowered to pay it forward ourselves, in like fashion.  

In addition to benefitting the world and its inhabitatants by way of spiritual osmosis, as it were, this and other such activities are directly beneficial to those who contribute.  As mentioned above, the opportunity to provide selfless service is potent spiritual practice.  This is an opportunity to directly advance one's own spiritual progress.  The key is to - first and foremost - regard your contribution as service to GOD.  Contemplation in this manner and service dedicated with this intention are high yoga - Where simply giving what you are comfortably able will undoubtedly bear fruit.  

Please know that this opportunity to serve Swami-ji is only that: an opportunity.  His own service - and that of all of us belonging to this lineage -  has no strings attached.  Our job is to serve the sincere seeker and we promise to render this service, toward the goal of self-realization, to the greatest extent that we are able.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Regardless of whether or not you are able to contribute monetarily, you can still play a big part in helping us reach our goal:

  • Please ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Indiegogo provides us with some excellent sharing tools.  Please make use of them!

And that’s all there is to it.

Please ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Indiegogo provides us with some excellent sharing tools.  Please make use of them!


And that’s all there is to it.

story:
A Dream Come True

by Russell Cutts

            As you know, a passion of mine is the study of fire. In particular, 'stone age fire'; how our ancestors made, used and integrated it into our livelihoods.  I've even pondered the "how?" of their discovery: when did our ancestors first overcome their fear of fire, and even salivate (!) at the smell of woodsmoke?  What happened -- so long ago -- that first time a human realized...I just made that ember...

            And, as you may know, it's been my good fortune to find a berth at UGA studying for my PhD in anthropology.  It's been a challenging year, and I've learned a lot.  I am so thankful to be where I am, right now; I am so deeply grateful for my family, and friends.  Many of you are mentors, or companions who've studied fire with me!  I have some delightful news: A Dream Come True.

            In pursuit of my dreams, I recently applied to participate with scientists studying at Koobi Fora, Lake Turkana, Kenya.  I was accepted.  Many of you will recognize Koobi Fora as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, often referred to as the 'Cradle of Mankind'.  The humans and their ancestors who lived there are amongst the most celebrated of fossil hominids recovered.  Working with paleoanthropologists from the Smithsonian Institution, The George Washington University, the University of Witwatersrand and the Max Planck Institute will be my start to truly, for the first time in my life, be able to visit those ancient sites and, first-hand, participate in investigating the biocultural revolution of our species.  I cannot exaggerate my excitement!

            In pursuit of this dream, I am asking for your assistance: please help me go to Kenya! If need be, I will borrow money to do this.  But first, I want to ask you to donate.  I do not need much, from any one of you.  I am asking you to give $20 or $100.  Or $15.  Or $50, or $5!  Donate to your ability!  As we have supported each other so often in the past, I continue to believe you are genuinely interested in what I work to do (celebrate human creativity, diversity and innovation), and will want to support me in this!  I think you would enjoy hearing about my studies, and what I learned; I think you would appreciate receiving a DVD of slides and film of my time in Africa!  I hope you would like a copy of the 2nd Edition of WildFire - Fire Making Art (intended to be a product of this work)!

            Will you help me achieve my African studies, in exchange for a fire-kit, or DVD, or 2nd Edition of WildFire?

            I hope to find the funds for this work from you, my family and friends.  Rest assured, even in these challenging economic times, any donation you can make will assist me in securing what further funds might be required.  I have provided the budget for these studies, so as to be transparent how your money will be spent.  As you know, I do have the ability to live simply ;-)  a little can go a long way for Russ.  I thank you so much for your ongoing support!  And I look forward to sharing what I learn of fire, with you!   

I NEED:

$5,985 Tuition -- I will receive credit hours towards my PhD!

$1,500 airfare -- into and out of Nairobi, Kenya!

$750 equipment/supplies -- Turkana, Kenya is a remote area of Africa! 

$50 Kenya work visa!

$715 miscellaneous -- lodging, transport, food (in Nairobi) and emergency funds 

WHAT YOU GET:

These rewards for your donation will arrive in December, 2013 -- I need time after my return to create them!

Donate any amount. These perks should be fun!

$10 donation -- a hand-drill fire kit!

$20 donation -- 2nd Edition signed copy of WildFire-Fire Making Art!

$30 or more donation -- 2nd Edition WildFire and DVD of my time in Kenya!

Your support assists me in raising the funds for this incredible opportunity!  All funds will be used for this summer study of hominid fossils, the Turkana fire-botanicals and local fire-traditions.  Regardless of the funds-raising goal, your donation will assist me in securing the total amount (I'll take a loan for the rest!)

Many of you have shared in my career, in my journey of studying ancestral ways and ancient fire techniques; little did we know that one day I would be afforded the chance to study with international scientists at one of the most famous of all fossil hominid locations!  Please continue to support me in this dream!

And please:  help share the word about this campaign!  Catch the spark and spread the news like WILDFIRE!

USE INDIEGOGO's SHARE TOOLS!!

story:
Help Keep Nicci Tina in the Streets!

For the last three years, Nicci Tina, a giant cig butt, has walked the streets.

Like a hooker with a heart of gold, Nicci Tina has been meeting, hooking up with tobacco users - hundreds of them - in the streets and in smoke shacks, from Seattle to South Portland, Maine and beyond, giving away free ways to kick tobacco, getting them hooked on freedom instead of the butts. She’s marched in parades and thrown coins at the kids, saying, “Hey! You! Stay smart and don’t start!” She’s written articles, published books and made videos. She gives away more than she charges for… a lousy business plan, but she says it feels too good to do otherwise. 

As a result of this obsession - this tobactivism - she’s burned through her own funds, leaned on and abused the kindness of friends, and in 2013, Nicci Tina may have to get A RESPECTABLE JOB - and she might end up working with YOU or with someone you love, and you don’t want that - trust me - because she’s restless, she’s volatile, and the work she was MADE to do - BORN to do - is streetwalking.  

Will you help keep Nicci Tina in the streets?

She has this campaign for the cause.  She’d like to raise a million – hey, who wouldn’t?! – to reach the billion tobacco users worldwide.

Nicci Tina really HAS TO raise at least $10K ($10,000) to cover basic expenses and stay in the streets.

(Not just $500, as the campaign says. Five hundred would barely cover the cost of her makeup. If you’ve seen her up close, you know what I mean…)

In addition to helping Nicci Tina stay in the streets, your support will help her continue to:

- maintain a social media presence through her blog and Facebook;

- write articles and books to reach and recruit even more tobacco users;

- make more videos to educate, entertain and inspire;

- collaborate with other tobactivists in the US and beyond, sharing buttkicking strategies;

- develop a broader message of individual and collective empowerment, and

- build a global network for buttkicking, tobactivism and more.

One man Nicci Tina approached in a smoking area stared at her for a long time until he shook his head and said, “You know what?  I prayed for you.  I’ve stopped drinking, I stopped using street drugs, but I cannot, for the life of me, stop smoking. I asked for help… I prayed for help…” and then he laughed and shook his head again and he said,

“Wow. God really DOES have a sense of humor.”

Do you?

And do you have a buck - $1 - for Nicci Tina's cause?

And will you invite your coolest friends to join us in helping keep this giant butt in the streets, where she belongs?

If you don’t want to use PayPal or a credit card online, you can just give a buck the old-fashioned way - in an envelope, by mail:

Nicci Tina, PO Box 88473, Steilacoom, WA 98388

We can then add your contribution to the campaign, as we have with others.

For whatever you can do - and do - thank you.  

Activism – tobactivism – takes many forms.  

We’re thankful for your part in this, and for your contribution.

For more information, and for free and low-cost ways to kick tobacco, go to: KickButtsTakeNames.com
