story:
The Parents Circle's 2017 Youth Summer Program is a  summer program taking place July 23rd-27th, 2017 in Israel. 40 Israeli and Palestinian youth, ages 14-18, will come together for five intensive days of getting to know each other, dialogue, education activities and having fun together through nature, arts, sports and games. The goal is to generate trust, opportunities for dialogue, understanding, and relationships that transcend the conflict. Parents are invited to the last day of the camp to support and encourage non-violence among youth. Many of the friendships go beyond the five day program, and the youth are in touch throughout the year supported by year long Parents Circle activities.

The program is developed and led by bereaved young adult leaders (ages 18-25) and Parents Circle staff and has been running for more than 10 years! The counselors now running the program were once participants of the summer program!

The Parents Circle is a joint Israeli-Palestinian organization made up of more than 600 bereaved families. Their common bond is that they have lost a close family member to the conflict. But instead of choosing revenge, they have chosen a path of reconciliation.

 

Help us Provide a Peaceful Summer Experience for Israeli and Palestinian Youth

Today's young people in Israel and Palestine don't have memories of a time before the conflict. They have grown up in societies in which violence and bereavement are a part of daily life. On a daily basis, they are told by the media and by the older generations to fear and to hate "the other side."

These same young people are the future of Israel and Palestine. It is vital that they are given the opportunity to form and strengthen beliefs in non-violence, peacebuilding, and dialogue.

The Parents Circle's 5-day Youth Summer Program provides a safe environment where young Israelis and Palestinians can share their stories, listen to the stories of their peers from the other side, share emotions, see the human in the other, and above all - create a framework of hope for a better future.

 

How We'll Use the Money

For every $1,500 we raise, we can support one pair of Israeli and Palestinian youth to participate in the Summer Program at no cost to them. Our goal is to raise $21,000 to be able to provide  14 teenagers--7 Israeli and 7 Palestinians, ages 14-18-- the opportunity to participate in this transformational experience. 

What's in store:

Games, nature activities, workshops, music, art, movies, tours, field trips, swimming, fun and most of all, time to spend  together and get to know each other, to know the "other" and humanize the "enemy". This is definitely a rare opportunity for Israeli and Palestinian youth to meet directly and personally, and a rare opportunity for them to share their culture and opinions.

 

Impact

Israeli and Palestinian youth are the next generation of peace leaders in their societies. While divisive, hateful propaganda toward "the other side" can continue to shape their world view and behavior, their still stands the chance to show them early on the Parents Circle's message that there is another way-- the cycle of violence, bereavement, and hatred can be ended. Peace is possible through dialogue, reconciliation, and an understanding of the other.

Our Youth Summer Program has seen many successes since our first summer camp over a decade ago. For example, we have seen the following results from camp participants:

  • 83% of participants showed an improvement in awareness of the other side’s need for respect and acceptance
  • 87% or participants stated that the encounter helped them understand the other side’s point of view of the conflict

"We talked about difficult and tough things, but the atmosphere made it easier to talk about things like this with no fear. I wish I could go back and re-experience this again."
-Palestinian participant, 2014 PCFF Youth Summer Program


"I feel like I'm leaving today with close friends and maybe it does not bring peace to the world but it does bring peace to me. I feel hope and a strong connection, and that this can be taken further."
-Israeli participant, 2014 PCFF Youth Summer Program

 

"I found something very important that started to grow in the camp - relationships, friendships and preparing ground for dialogue and genuine familiarity. If we are an organization that can ‘sow the seeds’, a lot of good things can grow out of it.”
-2014 Youth Summer Camp staff member

 

Goals of the Summer Program 

  • To contribute to mutual understanding and compassion  of Palestinian and Israeli youth towards the "other" 
  • To advance "emotional breakthroughs” in which attitudes and perceptions of the other side are changed
  • To develop the next generation  who will bring the message of reconciliation to their peers
  • To "humanize the enemy" using personal, cultural and historical narratives 

 

The Perks

To thank you for your support for this project, we are offering some exclusive perks to donors:

Bird of Reconciliation Watch--This Titanium watch by Boccia features the iconic Parents Circle “Bird of Peace” symbol and the words “Taking Steps For Peace” across the watch-face. A beautiful way to show your support for the Parents Circle’s Taking Steps In The Path For Peace project.

 

Pocket Blessings are a powerful message in the palm of your hand - a reminder to "seek peace and pursue it.

 

Two Sided Story, the Parents Circle's documentary, directed by Emmy Award winning director, Tor Ben Mayor. Two Sided Story is based on the PCFF's Parallel Narrative Project, which brings small groups of Israelis and Palestinians together over several months to learn and acknowledge the personal and national narratives of the other.

 

Taking Steps shoe laces, patches, shoes, and bags are products that have come out of our Women's Social Business, Taking Steps In The Path For Peace. The patches and shoes feature our iconic "Bird of Peace," hand embroidered by our Women's Group.

“If I who lost a loved one can walk the path of peace, then surely you can too”

 

Skype Meeting-- a private virtual meeting with a bereaved member of the PCFF. Get to know our story and have your questions answered in a meeting with one of our members.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Like and share our campaign link on Facebook or Twitter, and tell people about it - word of mouth works!

2. Send an email to your friends, family, or colleagues to tell them about this important project

3. Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date on the work of the PCFF! Subscribe here.

 

About Us

The Parents Circle Families Forum (PCFF) is a joint Israeli-Palestinian organization made up of more than 600 bereaved families.  Our common bond is that we have lost a close family member to the conflict.  But instead of choosing revenge, we have chosen a path of reconciliation.  Established in 1994, we operate education, public awareness and advocacy programs to create change. 

PCFF operates from two offices - one in Israel and one in the West Bank - with 16 staff employees.  The organization is operated and supported by a large body of volunteers from bereaved families as trained and experienced lecturers, facilitators and activists as well as institutional and private donors all over the world.

Our work has been highlighted in documentaries, books, the media and academic papers all over the world.  We have been recognized and awarded the International Gandhi Peace Prize, Common Ground for Peace Building in the Middle East, Eisenhower Medallion, and the Unsung Heroes of Compassion Prize by his Holiness the Dalai Lama.  

The American Friends of the Parents Circle-Families Forum (AF-PCFF) is a registered 501(c)3 organization that shares the human side of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict with the American public in order to foster a peace and reconciliation process.

 

 

 

Thank You!

Thank you so much for your support - every dollar donated and every share of this campaign to your network gets us closer to our $21,000 goal. Your support makes it possible for Israeli and Palestinian youth to take part in our summer program and to come together with the other side. We are truly grateful for your contribution.

*Note: all donations are tax-deductible; American Friends of the Parents Circle-Families Forum will issue a tax receipt for your donation.

Visit the PCFF Youth Summer Program Facebook page!
story_txt:
The Parents Circle's 2017 Youth Summer Program is a  summer program taking place July 23rd-27th, 2017 in Israel. 40 Israeli and Palestinian youth, ages 14-18, will come together for five intensive days of getting to know each other, dialogue, education activities and having fun together through nature, arts, sports and games. The goal is to generate trust, opportunities for dialogue, understanding, and relationships that transcend the conflict. Parents are invited to the last day of the camp to support and encourage non-violence among youth. Many of the friendships go beyond the five day program, and the youth are in touch throughout the year supported by year long Parents Circle activities.The program is developed and led by bereaved young adult leaders (ages 18-25) and Parents Circle staff and has been running for more than 10 years! The counselors now running the program were once participants of the summer program!The Parents Circle is a joint Israeli-Palestinian organization made up of more than 600 bereaved families. Their common bond is that they have lost a close family member to the conflict. But instead of choosing revenge, they have chosen a path of reconciliation. Help us Provide a Peaceful Summer Experience for Israeli and Palestinian YouthToday's young people in Israel and Palestine don't have memories of a time before the conflict. They have grown up in societies in which violence and bereavement are a part of daily life. On a daily basis, they are told by the media and by the older generations to fear and to hate "the other side."These same young people are the future of Israel and Palestine. It is vital that they are given the opportunity to form and strengthen beliefs in non-violence, peacebuilding, and dialogue.The Parents Circle's 5-day Youth Summer Program provides a safe environment where young Israelis and Palestinians can share their stories, listen to the stories of their peers from the other side, share emotions, see the human in the other, and above all - create a framework of hope for a better future. How We'll Use the MoneyFor every $1,500 we raise, we can support one pair of Israeli and Palestinian youth to participate in the Summer Program at no cost to them. Our goal is to raise $21,000 to be able to provide  14 teenagers--7 Israeli and 7 Palestinians, ages 14-18-- the opportunity to participate in this transformational experience. What's in store:Games, nature activities, workshops, music, art, movies, tours, field trips, swimming, fun and most of all, time to spend  together and get to know each other, to know the "other" and humanize the "enemy". This is definitely a rare opportunity for Israeli and Palestinian youth to meet directly and personally, and a rare opportunity for them to share their culture and opinions. ImpactIsraeli and Palestinian youth are the next generation of peace leaders in their societies. While divisive, hateful propaganda toward "the other side" can continue to shape their world view and behavior, their still stands the chance to show them early on the Parents Circle's message that there is another way-- the cycle of violence, bereavement, and hatred can be ended. Peace is possible through dialogue, reconciliation, and an understanding of the other.Our Youth Summer Program has seen many successes since our first summer camp over a decade ago. For example, we have seen the following results from camp participants:
83% of participants showed an improvement in awareness of the other side’s need for respect and acceptance
87% or participants stated that the encounter helped them understand the other side’s point of view of the conflict
"We talked about difficult and tough things, but the atmosphere made it easier to talk about things like this with no fear. I wish I could go back and re-experience this again."-Palestinian participant, 2014 PCFF Youth Summer Program"I feel like I'm leaving today with close friends and maybe it does not bring peace to the world but it does bring peace to me. I feel hope and a strong connection, and that this can be taken further."-Israeli participant, 2014 PCFF Youth Summer Program "I found something very important that started to grow in the camp - relationships, friendships and preparing ground for dialogue and genuine familiarity. If we are an organization that can ‘sow the seeds’, a lot of good things can grow out of it.”-2014 Youth Summer Camp staff member Goals of the Summer Program 
To contribute to mutual understanding and compassion  of Palestinian and Israeli youth towards the "other" 
To advance "emotional breakthroughs” in which attitudes and perceptions of the other side are changed
To develop the next generation  who will bring the message of reconciliation to their peers
To "humanize the enemy" using personal, cultural and historical narratives 
 The PerksTo thank you for your support for this project, we are offering some exclusive perks to donors:Bird of Reconciliation Watch--This Titanium watch by Boccia features the iconic Parents Circle “Bird of Peace” symbol and the words “Taking Steps For Peace” across the watch-face. A beautiful way to show your support for the Parents Circle’s Taking Steps In The Path For Peace project. Pocket Blessings are a powerful message in the palm of your hand - a reminder to "seek peace and pursue it. Two Sided Story, the Parents Circle's documentary, directed by Emmy Award winning director, Tor Ben Mayor. Two Sided Story is based on the PCFF's Parallel Narrative Project, which brings small groups of Israelis and Palestinians together over several months to learn and acknowledge the personal and national narratives of the other.
 
Taking Steps shoe laces, patches, shoes, and bags are products that have come out of our Women's Social Business, Taking Steps In The Path For Peace. The patches and shoes feature our iconic "Bird of Peace," hand embroidered by our Women's Group.
“If I who lost a loved one can walk the path of peace, then surely you can too”



 
Skype Meeting-- a private virtual meeting with a bereaved member of the PCFF. Get to know our story and have your questions answered in a meeting with one of our members.

 Other Ways You Can Help1. Like and share our campaign link on Facebook or Twitter, and tell people about it - word of mouth works!2. Send an email to your friends, family, or colleagues to tell them about this important project3. Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date on the work of the PCFF! Subscribe here. About UsThe Parents Circle Families Forum (PCFF) is a joint Israeli-Palestinian organization made up of more than 600 bereaved families.  Our common bond is that we have lost a close family member to the conflict.  But instead of choosing revenge, we have chosen a path of reconciliation.  Established in 1994, we operate education, public awareness and advocacy programs to create change. PCFF operates from two offices - one in Israel and one in the West Bank - with 16 staff employees.  The organization is operated and supported by a large body of volunteers from bereaved families as trained and experienced lecturers, facilitators and activists as well as institutional and private donors all over the world.Our work has been highlighted in documentaries, books, the media and academic papers all over the world.  We have been recognized and awarded the International Gandhi Peace Prize, Common Ground for Peace Building in the Middle East, Eisenhower Medallion, and the Unsung Heroes of Compassion Prize by his Holiness the Dalai Lama.  The American Friends of the Parents Circle-Families Forum (AF-PCFF) is a registered 501(c)3 organization that shares the human side of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict with the American public in order to foster a peace and reconciliation process.
 

 
 Thank You!Thank you so much for your support - every dollar donated and every share of this campaign to your network gets us closer to our $21,000 goal. Your support makes it possible for Israeli and Palestinian youth to take part in our summer program and to come together with the other side. We are truly grateful for your contribution.*Note: all donations are tax-deductible; American Friends of the Parents Circle-Families Forum will issue a tax receipt for your donation.Visit the PCFF Youth Summer Program Facebook page!

story:
Summary

We are the first student-led blockchain community in Manchester.

Do you want a better understanding of how Blockchain technology works? or have an idea in mind but not sure about the implementation of blockchain technology?

We are here to help you! 

Our aim is to help the adoption of blockchain technology by promoting its education, skills development, and end-to-end application.

What We Need & What You Get

Our plan is to organise educational sessions and events in order to support blockchain real-life implementation. At the moment we are working on several events: 

• Blockchain for healthcare

• Blockchain for gaming

• Blockchain for businesses

• Blockchain for developers

• What is blockchain and why should I care

• Guide to cryptocurrency

• Project Focus sessions where we offer business and technical support for blockchain enthusiasts.

We are welcoming any donations, which will support the operating costs of the organization to cover: 

• Developing and administering the association.

• Organising events and inviting leading blockchain experts to present at our events.

• Create an interactive youtube channel dedicated to Blockchain technology.

Interested to join?

Whether you're an established player or a curious newcomer, we extend an equally warm welcome to everybody!

Join us on our websites:  www.blockchainers.uk

Or on social media:

  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/Block_Chainers
  • Facebook: @blockchainersmcr
  • Instagram: blockchainers

We believe in a bright future of blockchain technology and encourage everyone to join us and make a contribution to our community.

story:
Please Help Me Help Them


Hello everybody. My name is Bud Brown. I am a retired teacher presently living in the Philippines. I live in a small village about 2 hours from a big city. We do have electricity but black outs are common.

I am constantly surprised how the people here manage to live on so little. As a teacher it pains me to see hungry children having to walk for miles to attend a crowded school. They leave early, about 0630 so they can be at school early to help  clean the classrooms and school grounds. They stay after school to tend their gardens. They arrive at their houses between 5 and 6 pm depending on how far they have to walk. 


When I realized the hard conditions here, I really wanted to help. But I knew just giving money was not the best thing in the long run. I found out that the men and women really don't want a hand out, but want to be self sufficient. There are several ways that the men and women can make a living, but the problem is they have no "start up" funds to invest in a boat or a sewing machine.

I believe we all would like to help our fellow man and I believe the "teaching a man to fish" concept is a good one. I would love to be able to help the men in our village have their our little fishing boat and the women to have their own treddle sewing machine (doesn't need electricity).  The women could not only make and repair their families clothes but could possibly make things to sell at the village market. My wife is a seamstress and is willing to teach the women how to sew. She told me many years ago she started with a treddle sewing machine.



I am asking you to contibute funds so we can buy small fishing boats and treddle sewing machines. This will help this poverty stricken village to become self sufficient and ragain their dignity that poverty tries to destroy.

I will be taking and showing pictures and videos of the results of your kind contributions. I can see it in my mind's eye. The dad's bringng home a good catch of fish to be eaten by the famiiy and what's left over sold at the market. The women feeling a sense of pride that their children are no longer wearing ragged and torn clothing...thanks to you. 

We are hoping to help ten families. They would receive a fishing boat and a sewing machine. Our goal is $7000. If we don't reach our goal we will help less families. If we exceed our goal, we will help more families.

Even if you are unable to contribute financially, please help by spreading the word of this project.

RECAP:

1 small fishing boat  $440  for ten families  $4400

1 treadle sewing machine  $200 x 10  =        2000

                                                      Total $6400

story:
Why I'm doing this,

This summer, I have the opportunity to receive school credit with HELP International (www.help-international.org) to go abroad to India. I am majoring in emergency medicine at UVU and finishing up my EMT Advanced this spring. I came across this opportunity to join help international and would relish the experience I would get using my obtained knowledge in this field to help people in need. I will be teaching some anatomy classes bringing awareness to the reproduction system, along with the effects of alcohol and smoking. I’m really looking forward to spending my summer abroad, helping people around the world, but I need help

How You Can HELP!

As a volunteer, I have the opportunity to raise funds to serve the community and support these projects. My goal is to raise 3,750 by May 15, 2013.

Even a small donation significantly increases the impact that we can have on the community in India. I am inviting you to join me with HELP International to serve the people of India by donating $35, $50, $100, $250, $500 or whatever you can*. Checks should be made payable to HELP International with Lindsey Walker in the memo line. Donations can be mailed directly to HELP International with the provided pre-stamped return envelope, or through Network for Good online. For online donations, go to the help website (listed below), click on “Donate” at the top of the home page, and include Lindsey Walkerin the dedication box. 

https://npo1.networkforgood.org/Donate/Donate.aspx?npoSubscriptionId=1006009&code=Website

This is the nonprofit organization link above and it is tax deductible if you do it through Help International themselve!

The Impact

As a volunteer, I will have the opportunity to initiate life-changing, sustainable development programs. One area that I am personally interested in is public health. I am confident that I can make a difference in the lives of the Indian people.

 

If you can't donate that is OK! Just help me get the word out!!!!

THANK YOU!

story:
My name is Zachary Malott and I am currently a sophomore at MSU.  This past semester I have been accepted into the College of Education, which is one of the most prestigious education programs in the country.  I am studying to be a high school history teacher and the closer I get to my degree, the more excited I get about teaching in the future.

I have the opportunity this summer to travel to South Africa as part of a teaching program.  This program goes towards my major, and allows me to experience how schools in South Africa are similar and different from the schools in the United States.  This unfortunately, is quite expensive, and I could use all the help I can get.  

I need to reach $1000 dollars to put a large dent in the cost of this trip.  Every dollar helps me fund the tuition and living expenses while I will be there.  However, seeing as I am being helped a lot by contributors, if you contribute $5 dollars or above, after the trip I will send you a digital file of all the pictures from my trip I can.  There will be well over 50 pictures of the landscapes, cities, and game preserves that we will visit.

I know that this may be asking a lot and I do want to thank you very much for anything you can contribute.  If you are unable to help monetarily, please share this page with as many people as you can and I will be very thankful.

 

Thanks again and take care.

story:
Meet Marysol

Marysol is a 30 year old graphic designer from Hermosillo, Mexico. Ten years ago, she participated in a study-exchange program with the Trilateral Consortium on Capacity Building in Community Rehabilitation and Disability Studies at the University of Arizona. Inspired by her time there, Marysol applied for and received a Fulbright scholarship to pursue research based on her interest in interaction design and inclusive design in the United States at North Carolina State University.

In the Spring of 2013, Marysol successfully defended her thesis titled Social Play and Bimanual Activities through Multiplayer Interactive Experiences for Children with Cerebral Palsy. Informed by research in physical therapy, social psychology, and inspired by interviews with professionals working in support centers for children with disabilities, Marysol designed a prototype to help children with CP develop physical capabilities while engaging with their peers.

Her Situation

After successfully defending her graduate thesis in May, Marysol's work was recognized by the International Association of Societies of Design Research (IASDR) when she was accepted to present a paper at their 2013 conference in Tokyo on August 26-30. 

Unfortunately, Marysol cannot afford to make the trip on her own. Transitioning off of her Fulbright scholarship and applying for PhD positions so she can continue her research has left Marysol without enough money to pay the expensive way to Japan.

In order to help Marysol present her knowledge to the most prestigious community of researchers in design, I have started this campaign for her. She has agreed to let me open her case to the world, and I hope that you will share my belief in her work. Presenting at the IASDR conference is a special opportunity to gain the feedback of experienced researchers that will help advance her mission to improve people's lives through design.

The Breakdown

Marysol needs help with all of her travel expenses. In August she will be relocating to Sweden to look for PhD research positions near my current residence in Sweden. Therefore, I would like to ask your help funding her:

- Conference fee at Student Rate ($369)

- Plane ticket from Stockholm to Tokyo ($1300)

- Accommodations in Tokyo (appx. $800)

In return, Marysol has several ways she will show how grateful she is for your support. During her trip she will be sending home perks based on your level of contriution. Additionally, she will be creating custom avatars based on the gameworld she created for her research. Finally, for the extremely committed, she will pick out a unique gift just for you from a shop in Japan!

The Impact

Helping Marysol present at the IASDR conference means that she will be able to share her committment to understanding and including people with disabilities as collaborators in the design process. I believe her work has the potential to improve the quality of life for people facing extreme daily challenges, and enrich the lives of others by promoting open, inclusive, and positive experiences through design — I hope you will join me in supporting Marysol on this journey.

Thank You

Every little bit helps. A simple share, post, or re-post will go a long way. Thank you very much for your time and support in helping Marysol make a difference with her work.

Additional Details

Here is the abstract from Marysol's paper:

Abstract: The World Health Organization (WHO) defines activity as "the execution of a task or action by an individual" and identifies activity limitation as "difficulties an individual may have in executing activities". Children with unilateral spastic Cerebral Palsy (CP)–a permanent disorder that affects one side of the body, and frequently involves the hand more than the leg– have activity limitations, hindering social and motor skills. In such cases, children often have limited bimanual upper extremity use (i.e. activities that involve both hands simultaneously). Increasing bimanual activity levels for children with CP can prevent subsequent functional limitations resulting from muscle weakness. Previous studies exhibit the potential for Active Video Games (AVG) to serve as an alternative to physical therapy for people with CP. This paper explores a digital interactive system as a means for promoting social play and the mastery of bimanual activities in children between six and eight years old with CP. Achievements of both of these goals will improve their performance in daily activities and have roles that are more active in social settings. Prototypes shown feature the design of multiplayer interactive experiences in combination with Tangible User Interfaces (TUI) – a type of interface that combines physical objects and digital interfaces– adding the therapeutic benefit gained from manipulating physical objects.

story:
My Goals for Costa Rica

  • Earn a certificate Teaching English as a Foreign Language (TEFL).
  • Learn Spanish while living in Costa Rica.
  • Build community.
  • Use my new language skills with my existing organizing, fundraising, outreach and education experience to work with a larger group of people regarding matters of social and environmental justice. 
  • Positively change the world by changing the community I live in.

¡Hola! Me llamo Ohia. 

I have a passion for travel, and I believe that my life's work lies in social justice. I will be able to combine these two things this November when I move to Costa Rica to take a TEFL (Teaching English as a Foreign Language)  course at a place called Proyecto Montezuma. While I don't find it necessary that every person in the world speak English, completing this course will make it easier to find employment, build a new community and continue on my path, working toward positive social change.

My plan is to take the course, and find employment teaching English, while simultaneously learning the country's primary language, Spanish, by living in it day-to-day.

While in Costa Rica, I will become involved in uplifting community organizations, especially those beneficial to women. I believe my background in community outreach, education, and fundraising will help me do just that, and by learning Spanish, I will be able to work with more people in Costa Rica, the United States. and eventually around the globe.

Prior Social Justice Experience (What I'd like to apply in Costa Rica)

  • 2 Years Work/1 Year Volunteer with Our VOICE (Rape Crisis Center) as Outreach Coordinator
  • 2 Years AmeriCorps VISTA service
  • 1 Year Multimedia Coordinator at Center for Diversity Education
  • 2 Years on Asheville Buy Local Committee
  • 1 Season Buffalo Field Campaign
  • 1 Season Cascadia Forest Defenders

I've Given A Lot To My Community And I'm Hoping To Get Just A Little Back. 

The cost of the course is $1500 and lodging is another $400. This does not include travel or food costs. Your money will go toward the cost of my TEFL course and lodging. This will give me a tremendous head start on my new journey. A small percentage will go to cover the cost of using this fundraising platform.

Whether speaking out about the end of Sexual Violence, fundraising for Women's healthcare, or standing up for the environment, I've given a lot to my community and I'm hoping to get just a little back, through your generous donations.

Plus there are some great perks for donating!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate that's ok, just tell a friend or two. Better yet, go do something to positively change your world.
story_txt:
My Goals for Costa Rica




Earn a certificate Teaching English as a Foreign Language (TEFL).


Learn Spanish while living in Costa Rica.

Build community.

Use my new language skills with my existing organizing, fundraising, outreach and education experience to work with a larger group of people regarding matters of social and environmental justice. 


Positively change the world by changing the community I live in.


¡Hola! Me llamo Ohia. 

I have a passion for travel, and I believe that my life's work lies in social justice. I will be able to combine these two things this November when I move to Costa Rica to take a TEFL (Teaching English as a Foreign Language)  course at a place called Proyecto Montezuma. While I don't find it necessary that every person in the world speak English, completing this course will make it easier to find employment, build a new community and continue on my path, working toward positive social change.
My plan is to take the course, and find employment teaching English, while simultaneously learning the country's primary language, Spanish, by living in it day-to-day.
While in Costa Rica, I will become involved in uplifting community organizations, especially those beneficial to women. I believe my background in community outreach, education, and fundraising will help me do just that, and by learning Spanish, I will be able to work with more people in Costa Rica, the United States. and eventually around the globe.

Prior Social Justice Experience (What I'd like to apply in Costa Rica)

2 Years Work/1 Year Volunteer with Our VOICE (Rape Crisis Center) as Outreach Coordinator

2 Years AmeriCorps VISTA service
1 Year Multimedia Coordinator at Center for Diversity Education
2 Years on Asheville Buy Local Committee
1 Season Buffalo Field Campaign
1 Season Cascadia Forest Defenders


I've Given A Lot To My Community And I'm Hoping To Get Just A Little Back. 

The cost of the course is $1500 and lodging is another $400. This does not include travel or food costs. Your money will go toward the cost of my TEFL course and lodging. This will give me a tremendous head start on my new journey. A small percentage will go to cover the cost of using this fundraising platform.
Whether speaking out about the end of Sexual Violence, fundraising for Women's healthcare, or standing up for the environment, I've given a lot to my community and I'm hoping to get just a little back, through your generous donations.
Plus there are some great perks for donating!




Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate that's ok, just tell a friend or two. Better yet, go do something to positively change your world.

story:
EVERY CHILD DESERVES QUALITY EDUCATION

Yet...
250 million children around the world lack basic reading, writing and math skills.
We are here to change that, but we need you!

Imagine a world where EVERY child has the opportunity to grow and prosper, where education, technology, and knowledge are available to them, helping them become the best they can be.

Without reading, writing, and math skills, this world is locked away.
Books... the Internet... Wikipedia... Google... All these must be unlocked... with education.

WHAT WE DO

Open Circles FOUNDATION is the philanthropic arm of Open Circles ACADEMY - a visionary educational institute empowering over 100,000 entrepreneurs to create a better world by fulfilling their greatest potential.

Realizing that the first step in creating a better world is a better education, we took on ourselves, as the non-profit foundation, the mission to transform the education system in the world.

For over 10 years we support educational projects we believe have the potential to change lives for good. During these years we partnered with the most successful and respectful philanthropic organizations in the world like:

  • Triodos Bank - supporting the Uganda Rural Development School for girls in Uganda (2008).
  • Virgin Unite - supporting the Richard Branson Center for Entrepreneurship in South Africa (2013).
  • Barefoot Collage and WWF - bringing solar light and training village grandmothers to become solar engineers in rural Madagascar (2014).

SCHOOLS FOR LAOS

This year (2015) we partnered with Pencils of Promise to bring life-changing education to children in Laos by building quality schools and sustainable educational programs.

Laos is a small country in south-east Asia. With 6.8 million people - Laos is one of the poorest countries in the world:

  • A third of the population of Laos lives below the international poverty line
    (living on less than US$1.25 per day)
  • Only 40% of teenagers attending school
  • Almost a third of the adult population cannot read and write.

These kids in Laos never had a chance… until now!

Until YOU!

WE NEED YOU

That’s why we’re launching this Schools for Laos crowdfunding campaign - to get your support and help these kids make their dreams come true.

Pencils of Promise already built 305 schools that serve 31,240 students in Ghana, Guatemala, Nicaragua and Laos.

Pencils of Purpose only builds schools for communities who are deeply committed to their children’s education. These communities contribute the labor and part of the materials, while Pencils of Promise (with your help) finances the project.

Building a new school for one hundred children costs €25,000.

With your help, we’re planning to build at least 4 schools as a result of this crowdfunding campaign.

Any contribution gets us closer to giving another child a future.

HOW YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE

Any amount you contribute goes to finance the building of a school.

In reality, by contributing €50 - you give one child 2 months of school.
By contributing €250 - you give one child one full year of education.

What you charge for a couple of hours of work can give a year of education for a child in Laos. Please join us and donate as much as you can.

Just imagine… How many doctors, teachers, artists, scientists, architects and entrepreneurs will these schools in Laos enable?

OUR THANK YOU GIFTS (PERKS)

To thank you for your generosity we want to give you too the gift of education:

From visualization CDs, to home-study courses, to our newest LIVE seminar: The Conscious Millionaire Path (November 2015) and...

Even an exclusive dinner with us to discuss your business or life challenges.

To make a difference in a child's life, simply choose your contribution level on the right column (under PERKS) and we will send you your gift in the next few weeks.

By helping those kids you also help yourself. Our educational gifts support you on your path to fulfill your greatest potential in business and personal life.

3 WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Here are a few ways in which you can make a difference in these children's lives:

  1. Contribute!
    A great place to start is to contribute and get one of our awesome gifts.
    Simply choose your contribution level on the right column and we will send you your gift in the next few weeks.

  2. Refer friends and win prizes!
    Would you like to win an all-expense paid trip to our new home in Tenerife,
    or one of our advanced 3-day seminars of your choice, while helping build even more schools?
    Scroll down to find out more!

  3. Share and Tag Your Top 3 Children's Books
    Which children's books have impacted you the most?
    Share your top 3 children books on Facebook, complete with a link to www.SchoolsForLaos.Org and tag 10 friends to share theirs too!
    We will get the most popular books to each school we build.

WIN A TRIP TO TENERIFE OR A 3-DAY ADVANCED SEMINAR

We are running a referral contest where you could win an all-expenses paid trip to Tenerife (our new home) or one of our 3-day advanced seminars (choose from Master Entrepreneur, Financial Freedom, Passive Income, Master Presenter or Breakthrough to Success, ).

Participating is simple:

  1. Make sure you are logged in to your IndieGoGo account.

  2. If you don't have an IndieGoGo account, go and register one by clicking here.
    When you are finished, come back to this page.

  3. At the top of this page use the share buttons to share this campaign.
    You can use the social media buttons, but also the Link button to generate your unique link that points to this page.
    Each time you share the campaign with these links - we will track them.

  4. Important! We are awarding the 3 prizes (Tenerife trip and 2 advanced seminars)  to those who get the most people to contribute to this campaign
    (to qualify - your network should donate together at least €5,000).
    So spread the word as far and wide as you can!

    Every person who clicks on your link gets you closer to visiting us in Tenerife and helps these children in Laos fulfill their greatest potential!

ABOUT PENCILS OF PROMISE

Pencils of Promise blends the head of a business with the heart of a humanitarian non-profit, strictly measuring the return on investment of every donated dollar.

By covering the operational costs through private donations, 100% of every dollar donated to a school goes directly into our programs to educate more children.

We don’t just build a school and move on. We monitor and evaluate every project we undertake, so every school stays fully operational and educating students daily.

Learn more at: www.pencilsofpromise.org

ABOUT OPEN CIRCLES FOUNDATION

Our personal and business vision is to 'create a better world by empowering people to fulfill their greatest potential'.

With Open Circles Foundation we manifest this vision by providing youngsters and children the best education possible to help them become the best they can be.

This IndieGoGo campaign is designed to leverage our resources by partnering with our community to create so much more than we could have created on our own.

Crowdfunding is a great way in which you can help making education available to these kids both in terms of raising resources as well as raising awareness.

We believe that everybody, including YOU, can make a real difference in these children's lives. And the time is NOW!

Learn more at: www.opencirclesfoundation.org

YOUR QUESTIONS, ANSWERED

Why the €25,000 goal?
This is NOT our real goal, of course.

Each school costs €25,000 and with your contribution and support we’re looking forward to finance and build at least 4 schools in Laos with this campaign.

How much money from this campaign actually goes to build the schools?
 With the exception of IndieGoGo/PayPal fees and shipping of the perks, every euro goes towards building the schools in Laos.

Will you update me on the progress of the project?
Of course!
At every stage of the building as well as when the school is opened, we will send you status updates including photos, videos and even an opportunity to travel to Laos and see the school and students for yourself.

What payment methods do you accept?
 We accept PayPal and major credit cards.

Can I donate from anywhere in the world?
 Absolutely!

When will I get my gift?
As soon as the campaign is over - in July 2015.

Is shipping included in the perks?
 Yes.

Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?
 Yes.

I have another question...
Please post any question as a comment (see the comments tab in the top menu), and we will respond as soon as we can.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Project Gazaab is an Overseas Community Service Project (OCSP) that is being run by the students of Singapore Management University. Gazaab goes to different locations around the world every year, with a mission to support communities in the fight against poverty through social entrepreneurship.The Nainital chapter of Project Gazaab was spearheaded in 2013, when a group of SMU students realized the need to introduce the concept of social entrepreneurship to help this community rise above poverty. Over the course of 10 days, Gazaab Nainital will teach a selected group of budding entrepreneurs about basic business concepts, such as finance, managerial accounting, business sustainability and so on. With this knowledge, the participants will present business proposals in a business venture competition. Gazaab will select winners from this group, based on the feasibility, sustainability and social impact of the potential money and provide the winners with seed money to venture into their businesses.

What we need to realise dreams:

Project Gazaab Nainital relies heavily on seed capital for its Gazaab Business Competition. Your donations will go a long way in building social enterprises that will lead communities in the battle against the vicious cycle of poverty. These donations are given by the team in stages depending on the progress of the participants.

Currency

Seed money per winning team

Number of winning teams

Total seed money required

INR

 50000 4 200000


Impact

Our beneficiaries are students from Sri Aurobindo Education Society. We aim to significantly change the lives of our beneficiaries, and provide them with the skill and guidance to start a sustainable business, one that brings a positive impact to their community, as well as helps them to achieve their dreams. 

Previous Success Stories


Flower Farm (2013)

Aarushi, a young 16 year old student of GIC Ramgarh showed incredible clarity of mind and the ability to spot business opportunities. With assistance from the Gazaab Nainital team, she was able to streamline her ideas and create a realistic business plan. She won seed capital fund­ing of Rs 50,000 and has now success­fully started her own flower farm.

She is expected to cover the initial investment and become profitable within the next six months, a feat by even Gazaab standards.

Organic Farm (2013)

Divendra Bhaiya, a man in his 20s living in the Ashram was able to generate fea­sible and innovative ideas, but had limit­ed means of implementation. His ability spot current trends towards healthy & organic food while providing clarity and detail to his ideas led him to win a seed capital funding of Rs.50,000.

Since then, he has invested in a complex irrigation system and is expected to reap huge re­turns once the trees mature and bear fruit.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share our campaign with your friends, family, and social media networks.

"Helping realise dreams, One entrepreneur at a time"

It is Project Gazaab’s dream and mission to enable and empower people to break free from the vicious cycle of poverty so that generations to come have access to education in order to rise above the poverty line once and for all.

story:
***** PLEASE SCROLL DOWN FOR STORY IN ENGLISH  ******

Pozdrav, ekipa!

Mi smo dvije mame koje su odlučile staviti sve skupljeno znanje i iskustvo u ovu našu zelenu papirnatu riznicu - Ivana Šimić, mag. nutricionizma  i Iva Janeš, mag.oec. i osnivačica Facebook grupe Zeleni život vege mama.

 

Zeleni život vege mama

Facebook grupa Zeleni život vege mama  osnovana je s idejom da sve što je vezano uz biljnu prehranu imamo na jednom mjestu, lako dostupno, za nas, a onda i za druge. Naše teme i ideje se redovno nadopunjuju i uređuju, oblikuju i selektiraju kako bi bile potkrijepljene znanosti, iskustvom i praksom.

 

 

 

Upravo tamo svoje znanje i iskustvo nesebično rado dijelimo već četiri godine te dolazimo u doticaj s mnogim izazovima poput intolerancija i alergija na hranu, suplementacije, izbirljive djece. Zajedničkim radom savjete, znanje i vlastito iskustvo preko provjerene stručne literature i iskustva drugih mama pretvorile smo u sastojke s kojima smo „skuhali“ našu kuharicu.  Što je najvažnije – recepte smo testirali na najvećim kritičarima – djeci.

 

 

 Brinemo za zdravlje i sreću naših najdražih

U današnje vrijeme problem je i prekomjerna tjelesna težina djece što dovodi do ozbiljnih zdravstvenih posljedica te predstavlja čimbenik rizika za razvoj kroničnih bolesti kao što su dijabetes tip 2, bolesti srca i krvnih žila, bolesti mišićno-koštanog sustava i zloćudnih novotvorina. Istovremeno, djeca i adolescenti koji se hrane uglavnom biljnom prehranom imaju veći unos antioksidansa i prehrambenih vlakana te manju sklonost pretilosti. 

Američka Akademija za prehranu i dijetetiku i Nutricionisti Kanade, jedni od najvećih svjetskih autoriteta na području znanosti o prehrani, još su 2003. godine iznijeli stajalište da je adekvatno isplanirana vegetarijanska prehrana (uključujući i potpuno biljnu prehranu)  prikladna za sve stadije životnog ciklusa uključujući trudnoću, dojenje, dojenačko razdoblje, djetinjstvo i adolescenciju, kao i  da osigurava zdravstvene dobrobiti u prevenciji i liječenju određenih bolesti.

 

 

Danas, kada se voće i povrće te cjelovite žitarice i mahunarke nalaze sve rjeđe na našim tanjurima, prehrambeni stručnjaci potiču i podupiru interes za biljnu prehranu.  

Putem društvenih mreža i grupe došli smo do zaključka da se dosta članova osjećalo usamljenim u svojim nastojanjima da djeci nude kvalitetne i cjelovite namirnice.

Pored mnoštva upita na Facebook stranici Vege mama  i kroz privatne poruke koje svakodnevno primamo nije bilo druge, nego stvoriti jedan praktičan, edukativan, lako primjenjiv i zabavan priručnik za sve one koji su (kao i što smo mi same bile) izgubljeni u mnoštvu informacija.

 

Izazovi odrastanja 

Baš danas Vaše dijete možda odluči da ne vole jabuku (a vi ste nabavili baš one najukusnije i uz to organske), ali možda voli sok od jabuke? Možda gumene bombone koje ćete napraviti za samo 10 min od 3 sastojka? Ili energetske pločice? 

 

 

Imamo rješenje! Riznica znanja- Zeleni život vege mama

 

Odgovore na ta i još mnoga druga pitanja skupile smo u knjigu.

Pa upoznajmo ju :)

 

Knjiga se sastoji od 3 cjeline:

 

U prvoj cjelini obrađene su teme od šarenog biljnog tanjura i svih potrebnih nutrijenata. Dotaknuli smo se i uvijek zanimljivih tema poput vitamina D i B12, izvora kalcija i omega 3 masnih kiselina u biljnoj prehrani, ekoloških proizvoda i ekološkog otiska, soje, klijanja te  superhrane.
Pozvali smo mnoge super namirnice, poput gospođe tikvice i gospodina batata, da nam se i same predstave. 

 

 

 

 

Drugi dio knjige posvećen je budućim majkama, trudnicama, dojiljama i bebama. 

Promjene koje se događaju u našem tijelu su čudesne, a drugo stanje zahtjeva i druga pravila. Tu se nalaze odgovori na pitanja poput treba li jesti za dvoje? Na koje nutrijente treba paziti?  Kako si pomoći kod pojave tegoba u trudnoći, ali i primjere biljnog jelovnika za prvo, drugo i treće tromjesečje te u vrijeme dojenja. Kada krene dohrana puno je upitnika u glavama novih mama i tata. Preporuke se mijenjaju, brišu i dodaju. U ovom dijelu knjige vodile smo se vlastitim istraživanjima, iskustvom i stručnim saznanjima kako bi upoznavanje s hranom prošlo što jednostavnije, kako za roditelje tako i za djecu.

 

 

Treći dio knjige je naša kuharica, koja osim recepata objašnjenih  korak po korak, donosi i praktične savjete o zamjenama za određene namirnice, o alternativnom načinu pripreme te prilagodbe recepta za bezglutensku prehranu ili recepta pogodnog za alergičare. 

Osim recepata tu se kriju i  primjeri jelovnika sakupljenih od iskusnih vegemama.

Što nam je potrebno?

Za izradu naše edukativne knjige potrebno nam je 10 000$.

 

 

Podržite nas :)

Kao dugogodišnje zaljubljenice u zdravu biljnu prehranu, dolaskom naših malih blaga i same smo se našle pred  velikim izazovom i pitanjem kako ispravno hraniti dijete slijedeći i dalje isti način prehrane. Stručne literature na hrvatskom jeziku jednostavno nije bilo. Do sad.   

Prvi koraci biljne prehrane od sada su puno jednostavniji, šareniji i zabavniji, a ova knjiga neka bude desna ruka u prehrani cijele obitelji.  

 

 

Hvala našim podržavateljima

 

I najmanjom donacijom korak smo bliže cilju, zato vas molimo da podržite našu kamapanju:

  1. Donacijom bilo kojeg iznosa klikom na gumb BACK IT   ili
  2. Kupnjom posebnih nagrada (perkova) koje smo pripremili za vas
  3. Dijeljenjem ove kampanje na društvenim mrežama, širenjem priče među prijateljima, obitelji i kolegama s posla

 

PODACI ZA VAŠE DONACIJE:

Udruga "Yoga za djecu Slonić"

IBAN: HR6523400091110928225

 

********** WELCOME TO OUR STORY IN ENGLISH **********

Hi guys!

We are two moms who decided to collect all our know-how and experience into this all-encompassing green paper treasury. We are Ivana Šimić with an MS in Nutrition, and Iva Janeš with a Master’s in Economics and the creator of the Facebook group ˝Zeleni život vege mama˝ (The Green Life of Veggie Moms).

 

 

Green Life of Veggie Moms

The ˝Green Life of Veggie Moms˝ group was founded with the idea in mind that all knowledge on a plant-based diet should be located in one place and easily accessible to all. Our topics and ideas are regularly updated, edited and selected in accordance to the latest discoveries in science, as well as on experience and practice.

 

 

 

We have been selflessly sharing knowledge and experiences for the past four years now via our Facebook group during which time we’ve come across many challenges, including intolerance to food and food allergies, supplements, and picky eaters. By working together, we were able to utilize advice, knowledge and personal experience as ingredients of our cookbook. For that final touch we used verified experts and scientific sources, other moms’ experiences, and most importantly- we've tested the recipes on our greatest critics – children.

 

 

We care for the health and happiness of our dearest 

Excessive body weight and obesity in children are constantly rising . That is undoubtedly becoming a global health problem of our modern society.  Obesity and being overweight lead to serious health problems and are considered risk factors in the development of chronic diseases, such as type 2 diabetes, heart and blood vessel diseases, muscular - skeletal disorders and malignant diseases. On the other hand, children and adolescents who mainly consume a plant-based diet have a higher intake of antioxidants and dietary fiber, and a lower likelihood of obesity.

In as early as 2003, the American Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics and Nutritionists of Canada, one of the world's largest dietary nutrition authorities, had already set forth the notion that an adequately planned vegetarian diet (including a plant-based diet) was suitable for all stages of life, including during pregnancy, breastfeeding, childhood and adolescence. They also asserted that a vegetarian diet provided the health benefits necessary for the prevention and treatment of certain diseases. 

 

 

Today, when fruits and vegetables, whole grains and legumes are greatly missing from our plates, it is the role of nutritionists to encourage and support plant-based nutrition.

Through our engagement on social networks and various groups, we’ve discovered that a lot of members felt alone in their efforts to provide quality and complete organic food for their children.

Following the numerous inquiries on our Facebook page and in private messages received on a daily basis, we decided to create a practical, educational, easy-to-use and entertaining manual for all of those who are ,as we once were, lost in the overwhelming amount of information available.

 

The challenges of growing up

Oftentimes, anything could pose a real challenge with children.Today may be the day they decide they do not like apples (and you've just purchased the most delicious and organic ones). So, we need to think creatively – could they like apple juice instead?

Pancakes with apples? Or perhaps apple gummy candy that takes only 10 minutes to make by using 3 ingredients alone, or even raw bars instead…

 

 

We have the solution! 

The answers to these and many other issues were collected and included in this book.

Let's get to know all of its facets.

 

The book is divided into three units:

 

The first part discusses the colorful plant-based nutrition and all of the necessary nutrients. We've also covered some very interesting topics like proteins, vitamin D and B12, calcium and omega sources, organic products and the ecological footprint, demystifying soybeans, sprouting and ˝superfood˝. We have invited many Super heroes, including Mrs. Zucchini and Mr. Sweet Potato, to introduce themselves to us.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The second part of the book is devoted to pregnant women, nursing mothers, babies and all future mothers.

While the changes taking place in our bodies can be miraculous, being pregnant still requires implementing different rules. This section includes answers to questions such as whether one needs to eat for two while pregnant, which nutrients should we be careful while consuming, how to solve various problems when they arise during pregnancy. It also includes examples of plant-based menus for the first, second and third trimester, as well as during breastfeeding. When introducing babies to solid foods, there are always so many question marks and dilemmas that parents face. Recommendations are always evolving and changing. In this part of the book, we used our own research, experience and professional knowledge to make food easier to understand for both children and parents.

 

 

The third part of the book includes our own personal cookbook, which, in addition to detailed and clarified recipes, also provides practical advice on replacements for certain foods, alternative ways of preparing and adjusting recipes for a gluten-free or an allergy-friendly diet.

In addition to the recipes, there are also specific menus that we collected from other experienced “green” moms.

 

What we need?

We require 10 000 $ in order to make this book a reality.

 

 

Support us :)

As long-time enthusiasts of healthy plant-based diets, and with the arrival of our precious children, we faced an enormous challenge and dilemma regarding how to properly feed our babies by keeping in mind our own diets. Even more challenging was the fact that there was no pertinent literature on the topic written in Croatian. Not until now, that is. :)

The first steps to the plant-based diet will be easier, more colorful and entertaining from now on. So, allow this book to be your ˝right hand˝ when choosing the optimal diet for your entire family.

 

 

Thanks to our supporters

 

Even with the smallest donation we are one step closer to making this dream a reality, so please support us:

  1. By donating any amount that you find appropriate  - click on BACK IT button , or
  2. By purchasing special perks that we have prepared for you
  3. Sharing this campaign on social networks, sharing our story among friends, family, and colleagues

 

DATA FOR YOUR DONATION:  

Udruga "Yoga za djecu Slonić"

IBAN: HR6523400091110928225

 

THANK YOU

***** PLEASE SCROLL DOWN FOR STORY IN ENGLISH  ******Pozdrav, ekipa!Mi smo dvije mame koje su odlučile staviti sve skupljeno znanje i iskustvo u ovu našu zelenu papirnatu riznicu - Ivana Šimić, mag. nutricionizma  i Iva Janeš, mag.oec. i osnivačica Facebook grupe Zeleni život vege mama. Zeleni život vege mamaFacebook grupa Zeleni život vege mama  osnovana je s idejom da sve što je vezano uz biljnu prehranu imamo na jednom mjestu, lako dostupno, za nas, a onda i za druge. Naše teme i ideje se redovno nadopunjuju i uređuju, oblikuju i selektiraju kako bi bile potkrijepljene znanosti, iskustvom i praksom.   Upravo tamo svoje znanje i iskustvo nesebično rado dijelimo već četiri godine te dolazimo u doticaj s mnogim izazovima poput intolerancija i alergija na hranu, suplementacije, izbirljive djece. Zajedničkim radom savjete, znanje i vlastito iskustvo preko provjerene stručne literature i iskustva drugih mama pretvorile smo u sastojke s kojima smo „skuhali“ našu kuharicu.  Što je najvažnije – recepte smo testirali na najvećim kritičarima – djeci.   Brinemo za zdravlje i sreću naših najdražihU današnje vrijeme problem je i prekomjerna tjelesna težina djece što dovodi do ozbiljnih zdravstvenih posljedica te predstavlja čimbenik rizika za razvoj kroničnih bolesti kao što su dijabetes tip 2, bolesti srca i krvnih žila, bolesti mišićno-koštanog sustava i zloćudnih novotvorina. Istovremeno, djeca i adolescenti koji se hrane uglavnom biljnom prehranom imaju veći unos antioksidansa i prehrambenih vlakana te manju sklonost pretilosti. Američka Akademija za prehranu i dijetetiku i Nutricionisti Kanade, jedni od najvećih svjetskih autoriteta na području znanosti o prehrani, još su 2003. godine iznijeli stajalište da je adekvatno isplanirana vegetarijanska prehrana (uključujući i potpuno biljnu prehranu)  prikladna za sve stadije životnog ciklusa uključujući trudnoću, dojenje, dojenačko razdoblje, djetinjstvo i adolescenciju, kao i  da osigurava zdravstvene dobrobiti u prevenciji i liječenju određenih bolesti.  Danas, kada se voće i povrće te cjelovite žitarice i mahunarke nalaze sve rjeđe na našim tanjurima, prehrambeni stručnjaci potiču i podupiru interes za biljnu prehranu.  Putem društvenih mreža i grupe došli smo do zaključka da se dosta članova osjećalo usamljenim u svojim nastojanjima da djeci nude kvalitetne i cjelovite namirnice.Pored mnoštva upita na Facebook stranici Vege mama  i kroz privatne poruke koje svakodnevno primamo nije bilo druge, nego stvoriti jedan praktičan, edukativan, lako primjenjiv i zabavan priručnik za sve one koji su (kao i što smo mi same bile) izgubljeni u mnoštvu informacija. Izazovi odrastanja Baš danas Vaše dijete možda odluči da ne vole jabuku (a vi ste nabavili baš one najukusnije i uz to organske), ali možda voli sok od jabuke? Možda gumene bombone koje ćete napraviti za samo 10 min od 3 sastojka? Ili energetske pločice?   
Imamo rješenje! Riznica znanja- Zeleni život vege mama
 Odgovore na ta i još mnoga druga pitanja skupile smo u knjigu. Pa upoznajmo ju :) Knjiga se sastoji od 3 cjeline: U prvoj cjelini obrađene su teme od šarenog biljnog tanjura i svih potrebnih nutrijenata. Dotaknuli smo se i uvijek zanimljivih tema poput vitamina D i B12, izvora kalcija i omega 3 masnih kiselina u biljnoj prehrani, ekoloških proizvoda i ekološkog otiska, soje, klijanja te  superhrane.Pozvali smo mnoge super namirnice, poput gospođe tikvice i gospodina batata, da nam se i same predstave.     Drugi dio knjige posvećen je budućim majkama, trudnicama, dojiljama i bebama. Promjene koje se događaju u našem tijelu su čudesne, a drugo stanje zahtjeva i druga pravila. Tu se nalaze odgovori na pitanja poput treba li jesti za dvoje? Na koje nutrijente treba paziti?  Kako si pomoći kod pojave tegoba u trudnoći, ali i primjere biljnog jelovnika za prvo, drugo i treće tromjesečje te u vrijeme dojenja. Kada krene dohrana puno je upitnika u glavama novih mama i tata. Preporuke se mijenjaju, brišu i dodaju. U ovom dijelu knjige vodile smo se vlastitim istraživanjima, iskustvom i stručnim saznanjima kako bi upoznavanje s hranom prošlo što jednostavnije, kako za roditelje tako i za djecu.  Treći dio knjige je naša kuharica, koja osim recepata objašnjenih  korak po korak, donosi i praktične savjete o zamjenama za određene namirnice, o alternativnom načinu pripreme te prilagodbe recepta za bezglutensku prehranu ili recepta pogodnog za alergičare. Osim recepata tu se kriju i  primjeri jelovnika sakupljenih od iskusnih vegemama.Što nam je potrebno?Za izradu naše edukativne knjige potrebno nam je 10 000$.  Podržite nas :)Kao dugogodišnje zaljubljenice u zdravu biljnu prehranu, dolaskom naših malih blaga i same smo se našle pred  velikim izazovom i pitanjem kako ispravno hraniti dijete slijedeći i dalje isti način prehrane. Stručne literature na hrvatskom jeziku jednostavno nije bilo. Do sad.   Prvi koraci biljne prehrane od sada su puno jednostavniji, šareniji i zabavniji, a ova knjiga neka bude desna ruka u prehrani cijele obitelji.    Hvala našim podržavateljima I najmanjom donacijom korak smo bliže cilju, zato vas molimo da podržite našu kamapanju:

story:
Not Perfectly Normal

Since 2005, the Harry Potter Alliance has striven to make activism more accessible and sustainable for fans of story. Under normal circumstances, our model has worked quite well: we’ve compelled Warner Bros. to commit to ethical cocoa sourcing for Harry Potter chocolate products, built a network of over 20,000 video creators and fans to advocate for net neutrality, leveraged the Hunger Games films to raise awareness of economic inequality and win critical victories in the fight for a fair minimum wage, and much more.

Here’s the problem: circumstances are no longer normal. To put it in Harry Potter terms: The Ministry has been infiltrated, Death Eaters are manipulating facts and controlling how they’re reported, and good-hearted witches and wizards are feeling burnt out and devoid of agency. For years, the Harry Potter Alliance has encouraged its members to think of themselves as real-world heroes, the Hermione Grangers and Albus Dumbledores of our world. But as individualistic thinking dominates our political and social rhetoric, we believe the solution to our most challenging problems resides in our ability to establish a collective narrative and build a more collaborative future. So...

Our Neville Fights Back campaign has been given an upgrade! On September 7, we launched Dumbledore’s Army Fights Back, a nimble and responsive action platform designed to channel the passion and energy of fandom into several of the most critical social issues of our time. There are two main components of this ongoing campaign: the Issue Platform, and the Operations Model. 

Why Does This Need Funding?

Launching a new action platform is one thing. Keeping it going for the long haul requires substantial resources, talented staff, and a lot of support from our volunteers and members. Dumbledore’s Army Fights Back has the potential to generate hundreds, even thousands of actions per week. Over time, this level of engagement can change the world. And that’s why we’re breaking our old model of strict campaign timelines and end dates on action. We intend to keep fighting for our platform issues until our vision becomes reality!

For every $1,500 we raise, we’ll be able to keep this campaign going for one week. If we meet our initial goal of $30,000, we'll be able to commit to 20 weeks of meaningful action on our platform issues! 

Whether you have a dollar to spare or the resources to become an official Dumbledore’s Army Sponsor, we’ve provided perk bundles to satisfy a broad range of magical philanthropists. We’ll also be releasing exclusive perks from amazing partners like Starkid, LeakyCon, Rainbow Rowell, Mark Oshiro, and more as the campaign unfolds! Be the first to find out about new perks by joining our email list.

Resistance Is Magic In the Press!

Meet the Team

Acacia Ludwig, Creative Director. Growing up in a family of artists and surrounded by the vibrant world of Chinatown, New York, Acacia strives to embody a deep and sincere love for artistic expression, good storytelling, and social justice for all people. While she has had stints in acting and modeling, Acacia’s most dedicated work is in music and design. As a musician, Acacia has had the honor to collaborate with some of the world’s greatest rock musicians while living in LA, NYC, and her current home of Woodstock, New York. As a designer, Acacia has created a countless array of logos and web sites for a variety of bands and social justice organizations. She has been working with the HPA since 2007, literally shaping the face of the organization with her artwork and attitude.

Amber Ducharme, Finance Director. Amber is a proud Hufflepuff who enjoys using her love of numbers to help make the world a better place. With ten years of experience in nonprofit accounting, Amber oversees the HPA's Finance and Human Resources Departments. She holds a B.A. in Mathematics and an M.S. in Accounting.

Janae Phillips, Director of Leadership & Education. In her ten years as a program designer and community organizer Janae has been a passionate advocate for creating more playful, engaging leadership training. She manages the HPA’s chapters program, which spans six continents, is the architect behind their immersive story-based leadership retreat, and is their lead curriculum writer. Janae holds a B.S. in Family Studies and Human Development, concentration in Leadership Studies and Practice, and an M.S. in Educational Technology.

Katie Bowers, Campaigns Director. As the Campaigns Director for the Harry Potter Alliance, Katie has organized thousands of fans across the globe to make a difference on gender equity, LGBTQ+ rights, literacy, access to education, and more. Her favorite part of working for the HPA is seeing our creative, enthusiastic members shaping their communities! A Ravenclaw hoping to do some good, Katie has been integrating her love of pop culture and social justice through organizing initiatives and experiential education since 2005.  

Matt Maggiacomo, Executive Director. In 2005, Matt accidentally fell down the rabbit hole of Harry Potter fandom and hasn’t emerged since. After spending five years touring the United States, Canada, and Europe with his wizard rock band, The Whomping Willows, Matt landed his first job at the Harry Potter Alliance in 2013. As the HPA’s first Chapters Director, Matt fostered the creation of Granger Leadership Academy and led the expansion of HPA Chapters across six continents. Matt has served as the HPA's Executive Director since January 2015. He earned a B.A. in English from UMASS-Amherst in 2001.
