story:
Our Story

Drums roll, flags wave, a stilt walker hula hoops while marching down Alberta Street. It's part marching band, part circus and a whole lot of fun!  

The Joy Now Arts Project is a performing arts program for youth 12-18 years old, based in Portland, OR.  

Our progam was founded and is taught by members of the wild and joyfully infectious  MarchFourth Marching Band - Portland's own big band rock n roll carnival circus spectacular!  

In 2011 we decided to start a summer camp for teenagers. This was inspired by our desire to bring  the magic of MarchFourth into the community and by our passion and dedication to offer ways for the next generation of youth to express and empower themselves.   We wanted to create something wild and original that would focus on cultivating creativity and artistic passion as much as it would foster a greater sense of self-worth and confidence in the youth participating.

Since then, we have offered TWO wildly succcessful summer camps and now we are excited to announce the kick-off of our year round after school program! 

Our program is being built from the ground up. 100% of our revenue comes from student tuition and support from people like YOU.  We want our program to be accessible to any youth who wishes to join and we need your help!

We know that the students who can benefit the most from this kind of experience are often those without the financial means to afford it. Your donation will mean more students can join and get access to this life-changing experience. 

 

You can help us make it happen!

Your donations help us ensure equal access to performance arts education for all youth!  

Helping us reach our goal of $5,000 will allow us to: 

  • Offer 16 scholarships to youth to be able to attend our Performance Program!
  • Purchase instruments, circus mats, drums, hula hoops, stilts and other much needed camp supplies

If we don't meet our goal, all funds receieved will go into our scholarship fund or towards buying much needed supplies.

Not only will you be karmically rewarded for contributing to such a worthwhile cause, we're also throwing in some rewards! Check out our list of awesome incentives to the right.

 

The Impact

All over the country, schools are navigating drastically diminishing budgets. Unfortunately, arts education is one of the first subject areas to be cut. We know the crucial role that music and art plays in intellectual and personal development. After all, it was these school programs that started many of us on our own paths to creativity. 

That's why we're so excited to offer an alternative to students who do not have band programs or other performance arts opportunities in their schools. Even for students whose parents can afford private lessons, nothing can replace the valuable and often more rewarding experience of being part of a larger band. 

The Joy Now Arts Project after school programs will give youth the chance to participate fully and actively in a community centered around art and positive collaboration.  As well as a music & performance art program, it is also a life-skills, and global awareness program. Youth will have the chance to do new things, explore multiple creative practices, learn and share different points of view, build self-confidence, and learn how to use art for positive and effective social change. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to take your investment further?  We have many other ways for you to get involved:

  • Share this campaign with your friends, families and coworkers via email, twitter and Facebook. This is VERY EFFECTIVE! 
  • Ask your favorite bar to host a happy hour benefit
  • Petition your local thrift store for costume donations
  • Approach your neighborhood grocery store for food and drink donations
  • While you're spring cleaning, separate out those old art supplies & give them a new home (with us!)
  • No idea is too small or insignificant! 


Visit our WEBSITE for more ideas of how to help!

story:
Who are we?

Two years ago five women were each pondering miscarriage and loss and thinking there needed to be better education and support for those who experience it... Then Kimberlee left a comment on Jenni's Blog, Jenni left a comment on Molly's blog, Molly called Michelle, Jenni called Jena, we all started talking, and within weeks The Amethyst Network was born.

We all feel passionately that there is a lack of education about miscarriage in this country, and even worse there is a real lack of support for those who experience it. 1 in 4 pregnancies ends in miscarriage, and yet almost nobody talks about it. We challenge that taboo in the name of being able to help those who are grieving when they need it most.

Where does the money go?

Although all our board members and doulas are volunteers, we still need some money for basic operating costs.

  • Website hosting
  • Printing expenses for passalong cards, brochures, and posters to hang in waiting rooms
  • Items for Healing Boxes for bereaved parents
  • Expenses related to the loss doula certification and support programs
  • Expanding our nonprofit status to additional states (currently we are only registered for tax exemption in one state) and to get federal 501c3 status

Whether we reach our funding goal or not, the money we earn here will go toward these things.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that times are lean for many of you. If you are not able to donate, please at least share our link with others who may be able to do so.
Thank you!

Thank you!

story:
The Detroit Food Academy is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that uses community-focused food entrepreneurship as a vehicle to activate high school students as critical thinkers, self starters, conscious consumers, life-long learners, values-based leaders, and community activists. As our students craft values-based products from scratch to market, they grow as powerful and thoughtful leaders with the skills and resources necessary to affect change both within their communities and beyond.


Program Structure: The Food Academy is split into two components: The Academy and Small Batch Entrepreneurship Camp.

The Academy is a 25-week program during the school year. Participants graduate with a polished values-based food product, a certificate in food entrepreneurship, a network of potential employers, and an opportunity to enter our summer employment program.

Small Batch Entrepreneurship Camp is a 6-week summer program that puts Academy graduates in the driver's seat of their food business. They are employed 25 hours per week to launch, operate, and perfect their triple-bottom-line food business at farmers' markets and retail outlets across the City.


Detroit Food Academy students Popy and Taryn selling zucchini muffins (made with applesauce instead of butter) and Michigan-sourced Mitten Bites (raw granola bites filled with oats, honey, and peanut butter) at the Downtown Market, Summer 2013

Results: As of August 15th, we completed another successful round of our Small Batch Entrepreneurship Camp with 10 young Detroiters launching their Zucchini Muffin and Mitten Bites businesses at four farmers' markets throughout the city. In 2.5 years of programming, we have taught 142 students and employed 100. (For most of them, we were their first job.) We have run 13 successful market stands and grossed $30,000 in sales. 

The Plan for 2013-2014: After 5 iterations and evolutions, we have solidified curriculum that WORKS. And we are ready to GROW. This $10,000 campaign is part of a larger $100,000 campaign to expand our program to 5 schools (7 cohorts) and 100 students. We are pursuing grants and corporate sponsorship, but individual contributions are an essential piece of diversifying our revenue streams and maintaining resiliency, so that we are not dependent on any single entity. We've all seen how that ends up...

Long Term Vision: By 2015, we envision working with 24 schools and 360 students. But as our education brand grows and our curriculum deepens, something even more exciting will be emerging alongside: Small Batch Detroit.

Small Batch Detroit will be an umbrella brand of shelf-stable values-based food products developed by our students, which will be distributed to corner stores, grocery stores, and supermarkets throughout the City, State, and even Country. All proceeds will generate revenue to deepen our work in schools and employ Food Academy graduates to grow alongside the brand, as well as have the opportunity to branch off on their own.

But we need YOUR SUPPORT to make this happen!

So check out the cool prizes in the sidebar to the right -------->, find a level you're comfortable with, and get in on the ground floor of this exciting journey. Every investment has profound impact on one individual, but even greater ripple effects on the leader's peers, family, and greater community.



And If you would like to support, but you can't financially contribute, we still love you, and you can still help! Email your friends or share our Indiegogo Campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and/or Tumblr. Give us a shout-out or make our logo your profile picture/avi and include the link to our campaign below!


Supporters like YOU make the Detroit Food Academy possible.

Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.

If you are interested in volunteering or making a Major Gift, please contact us at directors@detroitfoodacademy.com


A huge THANK YOU to our FOOD BUSINESS MENTORS: 

And our DETROIT FARMERS' MARKET PARTNERS:

story:
Short Summary

 

Booketplace is the best way to buy and sell used university/college books!

The basic idea behind Booketplace is to create a market for used college textbooks, allowing sellers to get in touch with buyers.

 

After watching our awesome video you will probably be able to understand that we are working extremely hard to provide a solution for all students to earn back some money from their used and now unnecessary books. Students spend $700 to $1,000 a year on books, think of what you could do with 70% of this money back in your pocket!

 

But that's not our only purpose, we believe that Booketplace allows people to become primary contributors in becoming eco-friendlier society. Today, we are tearing down tens of thousands of trees in order to print millions of books that are very rarely re-used. On the top of that, publishing industry lobbies greatly benefit from this trend which allows them to constantly increase their prices.

 

Today we are here on Indiegogo to ask for you help! We want to expand our app and release more exciting features, and we would appreciate your contribution. We can only do this together by strongly believing that we have to change of these ridiculous trends. We especially need your contribution if you firmly believe that Booketplace is a revolutionary tool.

 

There will be no more exaggerated costs for intermediaries, no grasping profits for publishers for new editions identical to the old, no waste of paper and trees for the production of additional issues that are likely to remain unsold for excess supply, reuse of books would otherwise be forgotten in some dusty shelf.

 

University students trying to make a big change in the society: this is the team!

 

  • Luca is an economics student at bocconi university in Milan. He has always been working as a coder and he just finished an internship at Google. He's currently in charge of the development of Bookletplace.

 

  • Giacomo is a graduate (110/110 cum laude) in Economics and Management and is now doing a master in Management at Bocconi University. He is director of a company specialized in web consulence b2b since 2009 and project manager in Booketplace.


  • Enrico is a graduate in Biotech engineering from Politecnico Di Milano. He's passionate about computer science and he's currently working as a developer for Booketplace.

 

  • Riccardo is a student at the faculty of Law at University of Milan. He’s focused on financial aspects of his law studies, and he is working as a consultant for a trust company based in Switzerland.

 

  • Bastien has just been added to the team to take care of the marketing side of Booketplace. He has previously been interning for various start-ups such as iZettle. He has also a background in Finance and Luxury goods. Bastien is currently finishing up his Bachelor in Management at Bocconi University.

 

Booketplace is helping you being Eco-friendly!       

                           

  • According to a study conducted by California high schools, the average weight of a physics textbook is 4.8 pounds. Taking into account the most common modern paper-making techniques, it takes 12 trees to produce one ton of paper, according to Conservatree.org. This means each tree outputs about 167 pounds of paper. This figure represents paper made using the "mechanical" or "groundwood" process.   

  • Using the average figures for average textbook weight and average tree output, a result of 0.028 trees per textbook can be reached. Similarly, it is found that 34.8 textbooks can be produced from each tree. On a campus of 10,000 students, each with 6 textbooks, a total of 1,680 trees worth of paper is being used.

  • Imagine now that thanks to Booketplace books can have a second owner. This would imply a saving of 50% on the paper used to print the same book. As for our previous example Booketplace would save more than 840 trees!

  • Now multiply this figure for the 151 million university students in the world and think how many trees we can save!

 

Fighting publishers' lobbies

 

  • Academic Publishers will tell you that creating modern textbooks is an expensive, labor-intensive process that demands charging high prices. If professors tell their students to buy a certain book, students have little choice on what to do.

  • In the past years publishers have done just about everything within their power to increase their profits, from bundling textbooks with software that forces students to buy new editions instead of cheaper used copies, to suing a low-cost textbook start-ups over flimsy copyright claims. Students also reported negative impacts from the publishing industry's long-standing bad practices that inflate costs.

  • 93% of the students said at least one such practice had affected the price or resale value of their books.

  • College stores now routinely offer students the option of renting a hard copy textbook – the format actually preferred by 74% of college students. The number of college stores offering textbook rental over the past two years has skyrocketed, and such print-version rental programs can save a student between 45-66% off the price of a new print textbook.

  • In addition, college stores continue to work hard to increase their stock of used textbooks, a 25% savings for students, and digital, which can save students 40% off the new-text price.

  • Nevertheless, those programs are only available in the US, which counts only for a small portion of the worldwide population.

  • But thanks to Booketplace, the average discount on a book can be up to 50%, making it the most competitive tool in the market.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • the funds we receive will be solely used for the development of the product. We have currently released a beta version of the application that contains the basic functionalities for the sale and purchase of a book. We plan to add many other features, to make the application increasingly fast, and work on the user-friendliness side of the app.

  • In particular, the next features in the development pipeline are: synchronization of the application database with that of amazon and google books, new user interface, an optimized experience for users with the latest versions of iOS and Android

  • To implement all of this we need at least 2 full-time programmers for six months, and the funds received will help us to pay (at least in part) their salary.

  • We will implement as many features as possible with all the money we can raise!


Have a look of our fantastic perks for the contributors! There are fantastic gifts, all branded by Booketplace!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Hannah, and I am the founding English teacher (a.k.a. the only English teacher this year) at a NYC public school opening this fall.  I am trying to raise money to purchase books so that I can create a library of reading material in my classroom - and you can help!

Tons of studies have shown that when students have time, space, and resources to practice reading on their own, their literacy skills improve dramatically.  Kelly Gallagher, an English teacher and author of Reading Reasons, writes, "My students now read many times more books than my students did during my first year [of teaching].  What's the key difference?  What accounts for this surge in reading?  Far and away the most important factor was the establishment of a classroom library.  I brought interesting books to my students.  I surrounded them with a variety of high-interest reading materials."

This is exactly what I'm aiming to do.  I want to create a library full of interesting reading material so that my students - who come to me with a wide range of literacy levels - can improve their reading skills and enjoy reading for pleasure.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I want to raise at least $500, all of which will go toward purchasing age-appropriate books for my students (YA novels, classic literature, graphic novels, non-fiction books, etc.).
  • If you contribute to this campaign, you will receive a letter of thanks from my students.
  • If the entire fundraising goal isn't met, I will still use the funds that are raised to purchase books for my classroom library.

The Impact

Your contribution to this campaign will directly help NYC public school 9th graders build their literacy skills and become more competent, literate, and educated individuals. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to donate books rather than money, please send me an email at mskassenglish@gmail.com.  Thank you!

story:
Dia del Nino/ Children's Day

Hello! My name is Sara, I have been living in Canada for 5 years but I was born and raised in Jalisco Mexico.
 April 30th is my birthday and also is the Children's day in Mexico. It is the greatest day to be a kid! It's a day full of celebrations, parents usually take their kids to school if it is a school day and teachers already have an awesome day planned for the students, there is lots of games, food, prices, toys and best of all no classes at all! Then kids get home and parents take them to kid friendly restaurants with play grounds, food menu and probably a gift from the restaurant and another from your parents.
When I turned 19, I realized is not fun for everybody. Given poverty in Mexico not every kid got to celebrate and that is just not fair, so I approached  an orphanage in my city and asked them if it would be ok for me to bring gifts on April 30th? They said yes, but only if I can provide gifts for every child in there, so I started to ask friends and family for money and put my own savings into this cause, when I raised enough money I went to get gifts for every kid in the orphanage, they provided me a list with how many boys and girls they had and their ages so I can get gifts accordingly (ages are 1 to 14 years old).
Once I had all the presents I wrapped them and put a card with the name of each kid on them.
The time, effort and money I put into it was worth it and I did it every year until I came to live to Canada.
I would like to start giving these kids a day they will never forget again and for that, I ask for your help!
There is an orphanage with 150 children in my city that I would like to help, the money would be spend the following way:
*$30 dollars for each kid gift bag (one toy, pair of blue pants, underwear & socks)
If there are 150 kids we will need $4,500 to give a gift bag to each kid.
$500 dollars will be used to get a cake, pinatas, candy, drinks, games to have an actual celebration for this kids.
If the goal is not reached, the money raised will go towards the celebration for the kids. Depending on how much we raised we can buy more pants, underwear and socks for them too.
I know this will not change their life, but it will have a positive impact because they know people care about them, and a smile in their faces are priceless.
Thank you for reading me.
-Sara Cardona
Please share my campaign!

story:
"If a butterfly flaps its wings, it able to create a storm somewhere"

We are a young couple, who would like to dedicate all of their past experience in Accounting and IT to the communities of Asia and make a genuine difference through volunteering.

We applied for a 3 weeks assignment by AFiD (Accounting for International Development), which focuses on development and enhancement of the skills,confidence and potential of local people and enabling the community to ultimately have the financial management capacity and understanding they need.

During the assignment we will be able to teach the basics of financial reporting, internal controls, IT skills and improve the English language knowledge of the local people. We hope that the impact we will make will be a long lasting memory.

With our knowledge we will supply one of the international charities or grassroot community based organisations such as street child centres, hospitals, micro-finance organisations, conservation projects, women’s empowerment programmes and schools.

At the moment our placement process is ongoing but we are sure in that these communities are all doing amazing work to tackle extreme poverty and inequality in their communities but due to their limited resources they are unable to access vital accounting and financial management training.

To start the butterfly effect we would like to ask for your support for:

- partially funding our volunteering fee (which is 1,300 USD for two of us)

- flight tickets (approximately 1,700 USD from Hungary to Asia)

We think that a successful project requires dedication from our side as well, so we would fund our:

- cost of living at the site (three weeks approximately 600 USD), which includes food and water, accomodation and airport pick-up

- registration fee for the volunteering program (500 USD)

For your efforts and kind help we offer our dedicated work and help to the selected community.

"If a butterfly flaps its wings, it able to create a storm somewhere" - let's help us to make it happen...

Thank you for your time. If you would not like to contribute to this project but like the idea, please share it in your social network. Thanks again.

(Please note that the video is only for illustrative purpose and not feature us.)
